1r""" 

2:mod:`~matplotlib.mathtext` is a module for parsing a subset of the 

3TeX math syntax and drawing them to a matplotlib backend. 

4 

5For a tutorial of its usage see :doc:`/tutorials/text/mathtext`. This 

6document is primarily concerned with implementation details. 

7 

8The module uses pyparsing_ to parse the TeX expression. 

9 

10.. _pyparsing: http://pyparsing.wikispaces.com/ 

11 

12The Bakoma distribution of the TeX Computer Modern fonts, and STIX 

13fonts are supported. There is experimental support for using 

14arbitrary fonts, but results may vary without proper tweaking and 

15metrics for those fonts. 

16""" 

17

50def get_unicode_index(symbol, math=True): 

51 """get_unicode_index(symbol, [bool]) -> integer 

52 

53Return the integer index (from the Unicode table) of symbol. *symbol* 

54can be a single unicode character, a TeX command (i.e. r'\\pi'), or a 

55Type1 symbol name (i.e. 'phi'). 

56If math is False, the current symbol should be treated as a non-math symbol. 

57""" 

58 # for a non-math symbol, simply return its unicode index 

59 if not math: 

60 return ord(symbol) 

61 # From UTF #25: U+2212 minus sign is the preferred 

62 # representation of the unary and binary minus sign rather than 

63 # the ASCII-derived U+002D hyphen-minus, because minus sign is 

64 # unambiguous and because it is rendered with a more desirable 

65 # length, usually longer than a hyphen. 

66 if symbol == '-': 

67 return 0x2212 

68 try: # This will succeed if symbol is a single unicode char 

69 return ord(symbol) 

70 except TypeError: 

71 pass 

72 try: # Is symbol a TeX symbol (i.e. \alpha) 

73 return tex2uni[symbol.strip("\\")] 

74 except KeyError: 

75 raise ValueError( 

76 "'{}' is not a valid Unicode character or TeX/Type1 symbol" 

77 .format(symbol)) 

78 

79 

80unichr_safe = cbook.deprecated("3.0")(chr)

83class MathtextBackend(object): 

84 """ 

85 The base class for the mathtext backend-specific code. The 

86 purpose of :class:`MathtextBackend` subclasses is to interface 

87 between mathtext and a specific matplotlib graphics backend. 

88 

89 Subclasses need to override the following: 

90 

91 - :meth:`render_glyph` 

92 - :meth:`render_rect_filled` 

93 - :meth:`get_results` 

94 

95 And optionally, if you need to use a FreeType hinting style: 

96 

97 - :meth:`get_hinting_type` 

98 """ 

99 def __init__(self): 

100 self.width = 0 

101 self.height = 0 

102 self.depth = 0 

103 

104 def set_canvas_size(self, w, h, d): 

105 'Dimension the drawing canvas' 

106 self.width = w 

107 self.height = h 

108 self.depth = d 

109 

110 def render_glyph(self, ox, oy, info): 

111 """ 

112 Draw a glyph described by *info* to the reference point (*ox*, 

113 *oy*). 

114 """ 

115 raise NotImplementedError() 

116 

117 def render_rect_filled(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

118 """ 

119 Draw a filled black rectangle from (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*). 

120 """ 

121 raise NotImplementedError() 

122 

123 def get_results(self, box): 

124 """ 

125 Return a backend-specific tuple to return to the backend after 

126 all processing is done. 

127 """ 

128 raise NotImplementedError() 

129 

130 def get_hinting_type(self): 

131 """ 

132 Get the FreeType hinting type to use with this particular 

133 backend. 

134 """ 

135 return LOAD_NO_HINTING 

136 

137class MathtextBackendAgg(MathtextBackend): 

138 """ 

139 Render glyphs and rectangles to an FTImage buffer, which is later 

140 transferred to the Agg image by the Agg backend. 

141 """ 

142 def __init__(self): 

143 self.ox = 0 

144 self.oy = 0 

145 self.image = None 

146 self.mode = 'bbox' 

147 self.bbox = [0, 0, 0, 0] 

148 MathtextBackend.__init__(self) 

149 

150 def _update_bbox(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

151 self.bbox = [min(self.bbox[0], x1), 

152 min(self.bbox[1], y1), 

153 max(self.bbox[2], x2), 

154 max(self.bbox[3], y2)] 

155 

156 def set_canvas_size(self, w, h, d): 

157 MathtextBackend.set_canvas_size(self, w, h, d) 

158 if self.mode != 'bbox': 

159 self.image = FT2Image(np.ceil(w), np.ceil(h + max(d, 0))) 

160 

161 def render_glyph(self, ox, oy, info): 

162 if self.mode == 'bbox': 

163 self._update_bbox(ox + info.metrics.xmin, 

164 oy - info.metrics.ymax, 

165 ox + info.metrics.xmax, 

166 oy - info.metrics.ymin) 

167 else: 

168 info.font.draw_glyph_to_bitmap( 

169 self.image, ox, oy - info.metrics.iceberg, info.glyph, 

170 antialiased=rcParams['text.antialiased']) 

171 

172 def render_rect_filled(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

173 if self.mode == 'bbox': 

174 self._update_bbox(x1, y1, x2, y2) 

175 else: 

176 height = max(int(y2 - y1) - 1, 0) 

177 if height == 0: 

178 center = (y2 + y1) / 2.0 

179 y = int(center - (height + 1) / 2.0) 

180 else: 

181 y = int(y1) 

182 self.image.draw_rect_filled(int(x1), y, np.ceil(x2), y + height) 

183 

184 def get_results(self, box, used_characters): 

185 self.mode = 'bbox' 

186 orig_height = box.height 

187 orig_depth = box.depth 

188 ship(0, 0, box) 

189 bbox = self.bbox 

190 bbox = [bbox[0] - 1, bbox[1] - 1, bbox[2] + 1, bbox[3] + 1] 

191 self.mode = 'render' 

192 self.set_canvas_size( 

193 bbox[2] - bbox[0], 

194 (bbox[3] - bbox[1]) - orig_depth, 

195 (bbox[3] - bbox[1]) - orig_height) 

196 ship(-bbox[0], -bbox[1], box) 

197 result = (self.ox, 

198 self.oy, 

199 self.width, 

200 self.height + self.depth, 

201 self.depth, 

202 self.image, 

203 used_characters) 

204 self.image = None 

205 return result 

206 

207 def get_hinting_type(self): 

208 from matplotlib.backends import backend_agg 

209 return backend_agg.get_hinting_flag() 

210 

211class MathtextBackendBitmap(MathtextBackendAgg): 

212 def get_results(self, box, used_characters): 

213 ox, oy, width, height, depth, image, characters = \ 

214 MathtextBackendAgg.get_results(self, box, used_characters) 

215 return image, depth

217class MathtextBackendPs(MathtextBackend): 

218 """ 

219 Store information to write a mathtext rendering to the PostScript 

220 backend. 

221 """ 

222 def __init__(self): 

223 self.pswriter = StringIO() 

224 self.lastfont = None 

225 

226 def render_glyph(self, ox, oy, info): 

227 oy = self.height - oy + info.offset 

228 postscript_name = info.postscript_name 

229 fontsize = info.fontsize 

230 symbol_name = info.symbol_name 

231 

232 if (postscript_name, fontsize) != self.lastfont: 

233 ps = """/%(postscript_name)s findfont 

234%(fontsize)s scalefont 

235setfont 

236""" % locals() 

237 self.lastfont = postscript_name, fontsize 

238 self.pswriter.write(ps) 

239 

240 ps = """%(ox)f %(oy)f moveto 

241/%(symbol_name)s glyphshow\n 

242""" % locals() 

243 self.pswriter.write(ps) 

244 

245 def render_rect_filled(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

246 ps = "%f %f %f %f rectfill\n" % (x1, self.height - y2, x2 - x1, y2 - y1) 

247 self.pswriter.write(ps) 

248 

249 def get_results(self, box, used_characters): 

250 ship(0, 0, box) 

251 return (self.width, 

252 self.height + self.depth, 

253 self.depth, 

254 self.pswriter, 

255 used_characters)

257class MathtextBackendPdf(MathtextBackend):

274 self.rects.append((x1, self.height - y2, x2 - x1, y2 - y1)) 

275

277 ship(0, 0, box)

283 used_characters)

370class Fonts(object): 

371 """ 

372 An abstract base class for a system of fonts to use for mathtext. 

373 

374 The class must be able to take symbol keys and font file names and 

375 return the character metrics. It also delegates to a backend class 

376 to do the actual drawing. 

377 """ 

378 

379 def __init__(self, default_font_prop, mathtext_backend): 

380 """ 

381 *default_font_prop*: A 

382 :class:`~matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties` object to use 

383 for the default non-math font, or the base font for Unicode 

384 (generic) font rendering. 

385 

386 *mathtext_backend*: A subclass of :class:`MathTextBackend` 

387 used to delegate the actual rendering. 

388 """ 

389 self.default_font_prop = default_font_prop 

390 self.mathtext_backend = mathtext_backend 

391 self.used_characters = {} 

392 

393 def destroy(self): 

394 """ 

395 Fix any cyclical references before the object is about 

396 to be destroyed. 

397 """ 

398 self.used_characters = None 

399 

400 def get_kern(self, font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, 

401 font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi): 

402 """ 

403 Get the kerning distance for font between *sym1* and *sym2*. 

404 

405 *fontX*: one of the TeX font names:: 

406 

407 tt, it, rm, cal, sf, bf or default/regular (non-math) 

408 

409 *fontclassX*: TODO 

410 

411 *symX*: a symbol in raw TeX form. e.g., '1', 'x' or '\\sigma' 

412 

413 *fontsizeX*: the fontsize in points 

414 

415 *dpi*: the current dots-per-inch 

416 """ 

417 return 0. 

418 

419 def get_metrics(self, font, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi, math=True): 

420 """ 

421 *font*: one of the TeX font names:: 

422 

423 tt, it, rm, cal, sf, bf or default/regular (non-math) 

424 

425 *font_class*: TODO 

426 

427 *sym*: a symbol in raw TeX form. e.g., '1', 'x' or '\\sigma' 

428 

429 *fontsize*: font size in points 

430 

431 *dpi*: current dots-per-inch 

432 

433 *math*: whether sym is a math character 

434 

435 Returns an object with the following attributes: 

436 

437 - *advance*: The advance distance (in points) of the glyph. 

438 

439 - *height*: The height of the glyph in points. 

440 

441 - *width*: The width of the glyph in points. 

442 

443 - *xmin*, *xmax*, *ymin*, *ymax* - the ink rectangle of the glyph 

444 

445 - *iceberg* - the distance from the baseline to the top of 

446 the glyph. This corresponds to TeX's definition of 

447 "height". 

448 """ 

449 info = self._get_info(font, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi, math) 

450 return info.metrics 

451 

452 def set_canvas_size(self, w, h, d): 

453 """ 

454 Set the size of the buffer used to render the math expression. 

455 Only really necessary for the bitmap backends. 

456 """ 

457 self.width, self.height, self.depth = np.ceil([w, h, d]) 

458 self.mathtext_backend.set_canvas_size( 

459 self.width, self.height, self.depth) 

460 

461 def render_glyph(self, ox, oy, facename, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi): 

462 """ 

463 Draw a glyph at 

464 

465 - *ox*, *oy*: position 

466 

467 - *facename*: One of the TeX face names 

468 

469 - *font_class*: 

470 

471 - *sym*: TeX symbol name or single character 

472 

473 - *fontsize*: fontsize in points 

474 

475 - *dpi*: The dpi to draw at. 

476 """ 

477 info = self._get_info(facename, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi) 

478 realpath, stat_key = get_realpath_and_stat(info.font.fname) 

479 used_characters = self.used_characters.setdefault( 

480 stat_key, (realpath, set())) 

481 used_characters[1].add(info.num) 

482 self.mathtext_backend.render_glyph(ox, oy, info) 

483 

484 def render_rect_filled(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

485 """ 

486 Draw a filled rectangle from (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*). 

487 """ 

488 self.mathtext_backend.render_rect_filled(x1, y1, x2, y2) 

489 

490 def get_xheight(self, font, fontsize, dpi): 

491 """ 

492 Get the xheight for the given *font* and *fontsize*. 

493 """ 

494 raise NotImplementedError() 

495 

496 def get_underline_thickness(self, font, fontsize, dpi): 

497 """ 

498 Get the line thickness that matches the given font. Used as a 

499 base unit for drawing lines such as in a fraction or radical. 

500 """ 

501 raise NotImplementedError() 

502 

503 def get_used_characters(self): 

504 """ 

505 Get the set of characters that were used in the math 

506 expression. Used by backends that need to subset fonts so 

507 they know which glyphs to include. 

508 """ 

509 return self.used_characters 

510 

511 def get_results(self, box): 

512 """ 

513 Get the data needed by the backend to render the math 

514 expression. The return value is backend-specific. 

515 """ 

516 result = self.mathtext_backend.get_results(box, self.get_used_characters()) 

517 self.destroy() 

518 return result 

519 

520 def get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol(self, fontname, sym): 

521 """ 

522 Override if your font provides multiple sizes of the same 

523 symbol. Should return a list of symbols matching *sym* in 

524 various sizes. The expression renderer will select the most 

525 appropriate size for a given situation from this list. 

526 """ 

527 return [(fontname, sym)] 

528 

529class TruetypeFonts(Fonts): 

530 """ 

531 A generic base class for all font setups that use Truetype fonts 

532 (through FT2Font). 

533 """ 

534 def __init__(self, default_font_prop, mathtext_backend): 

535 Fonts.__init__(self, default_font_prop, mathtext_backend) 

536 self.glyphd = {} 

537 self._fonts = {} 

538 

539 filename = findfont(default_font_prop) 

540 default_font = get_font(filename) 

541 self._fonts['default'] = default_font 

542 self._fonts['regular'] = default_font 

543 

544 def destroy(self): 

545 self.glyphd = None 

546 Fonts.destroy(self) 

547 

548 def _get_font(self, font): 

549 if font in self.fontmap: 

550 basename = self.fontmap[font] 

551 else: 

552 basename = font 

553 cached_font = self._fonts.get(basename) 

554 if cached_font is None and os.path.exists(basename): 

555 cached_font = get_font(basename) 

556 self._fonts[basename] = cached_font 

557 self._fonts[cached_font.postscript_name] = cached_font 

558 self._fonts[cached_font.postscript_name.lower()] = cached_font 

559 return cached_font 

560 

561 def _get_offset(self, font, glyph, fontsize, dpi): 

562 if font.postscript_name == 'Cmex10': 

563 return ((glyph.height/64.0/2.0) + (fontsize/3.0 * dpi/72.0)) 

564 return 0. 

565 

566 def _get_info(self, fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi, math=True): 

567 key = fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi 

568 bunch = self.glyphd.get(key) 

569 if bunch is not None: 

570 return bunch 

571 

572 font, num, symbol_name, fontsize, slanted = \ 

573 self._get_glyph(fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math) 

574 

575 font.set_size(fontsize, dpi) 

576 glyph = font.load_char( 

577 num, 

578 flags=self.mathtext_backend.get_hinting_type()) 

579 

580 xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax = [val/64.0 for val in glyph.bbox] 

581 offset = self._get_offset(font, glyph, fontsize, dpi) 

582 metrics = types.SimpleNamespace( 

583 advance = glyph.linearHoriAdvance/65536.0, 

584 height = glyph.height/64.0, 

585 width = glyph.width/64.0, 

586 xmin = xmin, 

587 xmax = xmax, 

588 ymin = ymin+offset, 

589 ymax = ymax+offset, 

590 # iceberg is the equivalent of TeX's "height" 

591 iceberg = glyph.horiBearingY/64.0 + offset, 

592 slanted = slanted 

593 ) 

594 

595 result = self.glyphd[key] = types.SimpleNamespace( 

596 font = font, 

597 fontsize = fontsize, 

598 postscript_name = font.postscript_name, 

599 metrics = metrics, 

600 symbol_name = symbol_name, 

601 num = num, 

602 glyph = glyph, 

603 offset = offset 

604 ) 

605 return result 

606 

607 def get_xheight(self, fontname, fontsize, dpi): 

608 font = self._get_font(fontname) 

609 font.set_size(fontsize, dpi) 

610 pclt = font.get_sfnt_table('pclt') 

611 if pclt is None: 

612 # Some fonts don't store the xHeight, so we do a poor man's xHeight 

613 metrics = self.get_metrics(fontname, rcParams['mathtext.default'], 'x', fontsize, dpi) 

614 return metrics.iceberg 

615 xHeight = (pclt['xHeight'] / 64.0) * (fontsize / 12.0) * (dpi / 100.0) 

616 return xHeight 

617 

618 def get_underline_thickness(self, font, fontsize, dpi): 

619 # This function used to grab underline thickness from the font 

620 # metrics, but that information is just too un-reliable, so it 

621 # is now hardcoded. 

622 return ((0.75 / 12.0) * fontsize * dpi) / 72.0 

623 

624 def get_kern(self, font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, 

625 font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi): 

626 if font1 == font2 and fontsize1 == fontsize2: 

627 info1 = self._get_info(font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, dpi) 

628 info2 = self._get_info(font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi) 

629 font = info1.font 

630 return font.get_kerning(info1.num, info2.num, KERNING_DEFAULT) / 64.0 

631 return Fonts.get_kern(self, font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, 

632 font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi) 

633 

634class BakomaFonts(TruetypeFonts): 

635 """ 

636 Use the Bakoma TrueType fonts for rendering. 

637 

638 Symbols are strewn about a number of font files, each of which has 

639 its own proprietary 8-bit encoding. 

640 """ 

641 _fontmap = { 'cal' : 'cmsy10', 

642 'rm' : 'cmr10', 

643 'tt' : 'cmtt10', 

644 'it' : 'cmmi10', 

645 'bf' : 'cmb10', 

646 'sf' : 'cmss10', 

647 'ex' : 'cmex10' 

648 } 

649 

650 def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 

651 self._stix_fallback = StixFonts(*args, **kwargs) 

652 

653 TruetypeFonts.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs) 

654 self.fontmap = {} 

655 for key, val in self._fontmap.items(): 

656 fullpath = findfont(val) 

657 self.fontmap[key] = fullpath 

658 self.fontmap[val] = fullpath 

659 

660 

661 _slanted_symbols = set(r"\int \oint".split()) 

662 

663 def _get_glyph(self, fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math=True): 

664 symbol_name = None 

665 font = None 

666 if fontname in self.fontmap and sym in latex_to_bakoma: 

667 basename, num = latex_to_bakoma[sym] 

668 slanted = (basename == "cmmi10") or sym in self._slanted_symbols 

669 font = self._get_font(basename) 

670 elif len(sym) == 1: 

671 slanted = (fontname == "it") 

672 font = self._get_font(fontname) 

673 if font is not None: 

674 num = ord(sym) 

675 

676 if font is not None: 

677 gid = font.get_char_index(num) 

678 if gid != 0: 

679 symbol_name = font.get_glyph_name(gid) 

680 

681 if symbol_name is None: 

682 return self._stix_fallback._get_glyph( 

683 fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math) 

684 

685 return font, num, symbol_name, fontsize, slanted 

686 

687 # The Bakoma fonts contain many pre-sized alternatives for the 

688 # delimiters. The AutoSizedChar class will use these alternatives 

689 # and select the best (closest sized) glyph. 

690 _size_alternatives = { 

691 '(' : [('rm', '('), ('ex', '\xa1'), ('ex', '\xb3'), 

692 ('ex', '\xb5'), ('ex', '\xc3')], 

693 ')' : [('rm', ')'), ('ex', '\xa2'), ('ex', '\xb4'), 

694 ('ex', '\xb6'), ('ex', '\x21')], 

695 '{' : [('cal', '{'), ('ex', '\xa9'), ('ex', '\x6e'), 

696 ('ex', '\xbd'), ('ex', '\x28')], 

697 '}' : [('cal', '}'), ('ex', '\xaa'), ('ex', '\x6f'), 

698 ('ex', '\xbe'), ('ex', '\x29')], 

699 # The fourth size of '[' is mysteriously missing from the BaKoMa 

700 # font, so I've omitted it for both '[' and ']' 

701 '[' : [('rm', '['), ('ex', '\xa3'), ('ex', '\x68'), 

702 ('ex', '\x22')], 

703 ']' : [('rm', ']'), ('ex', '\xa4'), ('ex', '\x69'), 

704 ('ex', '\x23')], 

705 r'\lfloor' : [('ex', '\xa5'), ('ex', '\x6a'), 

706 ('ex', '\xb9'), ('ex', '\x24')], 

707 r'\rfloor' : [('ex', '\xa6'), ('ex', '\x6b'), 

708 ('ex', '\xba'), ('ex', '\x25')], 

709 r'\lceil' : [('ex', '\xa7'), ('ex', '\x6c'), 

710 ('ex', '\xbb'), ('ex', '\x26')], 

711 r'\rceil' : [('ex', '\xa8'), ('ex', '\x6d'), 

712 ('ex', '\xbc'), ('ex', '\x27')], 

713 r'\langle' : [('ex', '\xad'), ('ex', '\x44'), 

714 ('ex', '\xbf'), ('ex', '\x2a')], 

715 r'\rangle' : [('ex', '\xae'), ('ex', '\x45'), 

716 ('ex', '\xc0'), ('ex', '\x2b')], 

717 r'\__sqrt__' : [('ex', '\x70'), ('ex', '\x71'), 

718 ('ex', '\x72'), ('ex', '\x73')], 

719 r'\backslash': [('ex', '\xb2'), ('ex', '\x2f'), 

720 ('ex', '\xc2'), ('ex', '\x2d')], 

721 r'/' : [('rm', '/'), ('ex', '\xb1'), ('ex', '\x2e'), 

722 ('ex', '\xcb'), ('ex', '\x2c')], 

723 r'\widehat' : [('rm', '\x5e'), ('ex', '\x62'), ('ex', '\x63'), 

724 ('ex', '\x64')], 

725 r'\widetilde': [('rm', '\x7e'), ('ex', '\x65'), ('ex', '\x66'), 

726 ('ex', '\x67')], 

727 r'<' : [('cal', 'h'), ('ex', 'D')], 

728 r'>' : [('cal', 'i'), ('ex', 'E')] 

729 } 

730 

731 for alias, target in [(r'\leftparen', '('), 

732 (r'\rightparent', ')'), 

733 (r'\leftbrace', '{'), 

734 (r'\rightbrace', '}'), 

735 (r'\leftbracket', '['), 

736 (r'\rightbracket', ']'), 

737 (r'\{', '{'), 

738 (r'\}', '}'), 

739 (r'\[', '['), 

740 (r'\]', ']')]: 

741 _size_alternatives[alias] = _size_alternatives[target] 

742 

743 def get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol(self, fontname, sym): 

744 return self._size_alternatives.get(sym, [(fontname, sym)]) 

745 

746class UnicodeFonts(TruetypeFonts): 

747 """ 

748 An abstract base class for handling Unicode fonts. 

749 

750 While some reasonably complete Unicode fonts (such as DejaVu) may 

751 work in some situations, the only Unicode font I'm aware of with a 

752 complete set of math symbols is STIX. 

753 

754 This class will "fallback" on the Bakoma fonts when a required 

755 symbol can not be found in the font. 

756 """ 

757 use_cmex = True 

758 

759 def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 

760 # This must come first so the backend's owner is set correctly 

761 if rcParams['mathtext.fallback_to_cm']: 

762 self.cm_fallback = BakomaFonts(*args, **kwargs) 

763 else: 

764 self.cm_fallback = None 

765 TruetypeFonts.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs) 

766 self.fontmap = {} 

767 for texfont in "cal rm tt it bf sf".split(): 

768 prop = rcParams['mathtext.' + texfont] 

769 font = findfont(prop) 

770 self.fontmap[texfont] = font 

771 prop = FontProperties('cmex10') 

772 font = findfont(prop) 

773 self.fontmap['ex'] = font 

774 

775 _slanted_symbols = set(r"\int \oint".split()) 

776 

777 def _map_virtual_font(self, fontname, font_class, uniindex): 

778 return fontname, uniindex 

779 

780 def _get_glyph(self, fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math=True): 

781 found_symbol = False 

782 

783 if self.use_cmex: 

784 uniindex = latex_to_cmex.get(sym) 

785 if uniindex is not None: 

786 fontname = 'ex' 

787 found_symbol = True 

788 

789 if not found_symbol: 

790 try: 

791 uniindex = get_unicode_index(sym, math) 

792 found_symbol = True 

793 except ValueError: 

794 uniindex = ord('?') 

795 warnings.warn( 

796 "No TeX to unicode mapping for {!a}.".format(sym), 

797 MathTextWarning) 

798 

799 fontname, uniindex = self._map_virtual_font( 

800 fontname, font_class, uniindex) 

801 

802 new_fontname = fontname 

803 

804 # Only characters in the "Letter" class should be italicized in 'it' 

805 # mode. Greek capital letters should be Roman. 

806 if found_symbol: 

807 if fontname == 'it': 

808 if uniindex < 0x10000: 

809 unistring = chr(uniindex) 

810 if (not unicodedata.category(unistring)[0] == "L" 

811 or unicodedata.name(unistring).startswith("GREEK CAPITAL")): 

812 new_fontname = 'rm' 

813 

814 slanted = (new_fontname == 'it') or sym in self._slanted_symbols 

815 found_symbol = False 

816 font = self._get_font(new_fontname) 

817 if font is not None: 

818 glyphindex = font.get_char_index(uniindex) 

819 if glyphindex != 0: 

820 found_symbol = True 

821 

822 if not found_symbol: 

823 if self.cm_fallback: 

824 if isinstance(self.cm_fallback, BakomaFonts): 

825 warnings.warn( 

826 "Substituting with a symbol from Computer Modern.", 

827 MathTextWarning) 

828 if (fontname in ('it', 'regular') and 

829 isinstance(self.cm_fallback, StixFonts)): 

830 return self.cm_fallback._get_glyph( 

831 'rm', font_class, sym, fontsize) 

832 else: 

833 return self.cm_fallback._get_glyph( 

834 fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize) 

835 else: 

836 if (fontname in ('it', 'regular') 

837 and isinstance(self, StixFonts)): 

838 return self._get_glyph('rm', font_class, sym, fontsize) 

839 warnings.warn( 

840 "Font {!r} does not have a glyph for {!a} [U+{:x}], " 

841 "substituting with a dummy symbol.".format( 

842 new_fontname, sym, uniindex), 

843 MathTextWarning) 

844 fontname = 'rm' 

845 new_fontname = fontname 

846 font = self._get_font(fontname) 

847 uniindex = 0xA4 # currency character, for lack of anything better 

848 glyphindex = font.get_char_index(uniindex) 

849 slanted = False 

850 

851 symbol_name = font.get_glyph_name(glyphindex) 

852 return font, uniindex, symbol_name, fontsize, slanted 

853 

854 def get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol(self, fontname, sym): 

855 if self.cm_fallback: 

856 return self.cm_fallback.get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol( 

857 fontname, sym) 

858 return [(fontname, sym)] 

859

861class DejaVuFonts(UnicodeFonts): 

862 use_cmex = False 

863 

864 def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 

865 # This must come first so the backend's owner is set correctly 

866 if isinstance(self, DejaVuSerifFonts): 

867 self.cm_fallback = StixFonts(*args, **kwargs) 

868 else: 

869 self.cm_fallback = StixSansFonts(*args, **kwargs) 

870 self.bakoma = BakomaFonts(*args, **kwargs) 

871 TruetypeFonts.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs) 

872 self.fontmap = {} 

873 # Include Stix sized alternatives for glyphs 

874 self._fontmap.update({ 

875 1 : 'STIXSizeOneSym', 

876 2 : 'STIXSizeTwoSym', 

877 3 : 'STIXSizeThreeSym', 

878 4 : 'STIXSizeFourSym', 

879 5 : 'STIXSizeFiveSym'}) 

880 for key, name in self._fontmap.items(): 

881 fullpath = findfont(name) 

882 self.fontmap[key] = fullpath 

883 self.fontmap[name] = fullpath 

884 

885 def _get_glyph(self, fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math=True): 

886 """ Override prime symbol to use Bakoma """ 

887 if sym == r'\prime': 

888 return self.bakoma._get_glyph( 

889 fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math) 

890 else: 

891 # check whether the glyph is available in the display font 

892 uniindex = get_unicode_index(sym) 

893 font = self._get_font('ex') 

894 if font is not None: 

895 glyphindex = font.get_char_index(uniindex) 

896 if glyphindex != 0: 

897 return super()._get_glyph( 

898 'ex', font_class, sym, fontsize, math) 

899 # otherwise return regular glyph 

900 return super()._get_glyph( 

901 fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, math)

934class StixFonts(UnicodeFonts): 

935 """ 

936 A font handling class for the STIX fonts. 

937 

938 In addition to what UnicodeFonts provides, this class: 

939 

940 - supports "virtual fonts" which are complete alpha numeric 

941 character sets with different font styles at special Unicode 

942 code points, such as "Blackboard". 

943 

944 - handles sized alternative characters for the STIXSizeX fonts. 

945 """ 

946 _fontmap = { 'rm' : 'STIXGeneral', 

947 'it' : 'STIXGeneral:italic', 

948 'bf' : 'STIXGeneral:weight=bold', 

949 'nonunirm' : 'STIXNonUnicode', 

950 'nonuniit' : 'STIXNonUnicode:italic', 

951 'nonunibf' : 'STIXNonUnicode:weight=bold', 

952 

953 0 : 'STIXGeneral', 

954 1 : 'STIXSizeOneSym', 

955 2 : 'STIXSizeTwoSym', 

956 3 : 'STIXSizeThreeSym', 

957 4 : 'STIXSizeFourSym', 

958 5 : 'STIXSizeFiveSym' 

959 } 

960 use_cmex = False 

961 cm_fallback = False 

962 _sans = False 

963 

964 def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): 

965 TruetypeFonts.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs) 

966 self.fontmap = {} 

967 for key, name in self._fontmap.items(): 

968 fullpath = findfont(name) 

969 self.fontmap[key] = fullpath 

970 self.fontmap[name] = fullpath 

971 

972 def _map_virtual_font(self, fontname, font_class, uniindex): 

973 # Handle these "fonts" that are actually embedded in 

974 # other fonts. 

975 mapping = stix_virtual_fonts.get(fontname) 

976 if (self._sans and mapping is None and 

977 fontname not in ('regular', 'default')): 

978 mapping = stix_virtual_fonts['sf'] 

979 doing_sans_conversion = True 

980 else: 

981 doing_sans_conversion = False 

982 

983 if mapping is not None: 

984 if isinstance(mapping, dict): 

985 try: 

986 mapping = mapping[font_class] 

987 except KeyError: 

988 mapping = mapping['rm'] 

989 

990 # Binary search for the source glyph 

991 lo = 0 

992 hi = len(mapping) 

993 while lo < hi: 

994 mid = (lo+hi)//2 

995 range = mapping[mid] 

996 if uniindex < range[0]: 

997 hi = mid 

998 elif uniindex <= range[1]: 

999 break 

1000 else: 

1001 lo = mid + 1 

1002 

1003 if range[0] <= uniindex <= range[1]: 

1004 uniindex = uniindex - range[0] + range[3] 

1005 fontname = range[2] 

1006 elif not doing_sans_conversion: 

1007 # This will generate a dummy character 

1008 uniindex = 0x1 

1009 fontname = rcParams['mathtext.default'] 

1010 

1011 # Handle private use area glyphs 

1012 if (fontname in ('it', 'rm', 'bf') and 

1013 uniindex >= 0xe000 and uniindex <= 0xf8ff): 

1014 fontname = 'nonuni' + fontname 

1015 

1016 return fontname, uniindex 

1017 

1018 _size_alternatives = {} 

1019 def get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol(self, fontname, sym): 

1020 fixes = {'\\{': '{', '\\}': '}', '\\[': '[', '\\]': ']'} 

1021 sym = fixes.get(sym, sym) 

1022 

1023 alternatives = self._size_alternatives.get(sym) 

1024 if alternatives: 

1025 return alternatives 

1026 

1027 alternatives = [] 

1028 try: 

1029 uniindex = get_unicode_index(sym) 

1030 except ValueError: 

1031 return [(fontname, sym)] 

1032 

1033 fix_ups = { 

1034 ord('<'): 0x27e8, 

1035 ord('>'): 0x27e9 } 

1036 

1037 uniindex = fix_ups.get(uniindex, uniindex) 

1038 

1039 for i in range(6): 

1040 font = self._get_font(i) 

1041 glyphindex = font.get_char_index(uniindex) 

1042 if glyphindex != 0: 

1043 alternatives.append((i, chr(uniindex))) 

1044 

1045 # The largest size of the radical symbol in STIX has incorrect 

1046 # metrics that cause it to be disconnected from the stem. 

1047 if sym == r'\__sqrt__': 

1048 alternatives = alternatives[:-1] 

1049 

1050 self._size_alternatives[sym] = alternatives 

1051 return alternatives 

1052 

1053class StixSansFonts(StixFonts): 

1054 """ 

1055 A font handling class for the STIX fonts (that uses sans-serif 

1056 characters by default). 

1057 """ 

1058 _sans = True 

1059 

1060class StandardPsFonts(Fonts): 

1061 """ 

1062 Use the standard postscript fonts for rendering to backend_ps 

1063 

1064 Unlike the other font classes, BakomaFont and UnicodeFont, this 

1065 one requires the Ps backend. 

1066 """ 

1067 basepath = os.path.join( get_data_path(), 'fonts', 'afm' ) 

1068 

1069 fontmap = { 'cal' : 'pzcmi8a', # Zapf Chancery 

1070 'rm' : 'pncr8a', # New Century Schoolbook 

1071 'tt' : 'pcrr8a', # Courier 

1072 'it' : 'pncri8a', # New Century Schoolbook Italic 

1073 'sf' : 'phvr8a', # Helvetica 

1074 'bf' : 'pncb8a', # New Century Schoolbook Bold 

1075 None : 'psyr' # Symbol 

1076 } 

1077 

1078 def __init__(self, default_font_prop): 

1079 Fonts.__init__(self, default_font_prop, MathtextBackendPs()) 

1080 self.glyphd = {} 

1081 self.fonts = {} 

1082 

1083 filename = findfont(default_font_prop, fontext='afm', 

1084 directory=self.basepath) 

1085 if filename is None: 

1086 filename = findfont('Helvetica', fontext='afm', 

1087 directory=self.basepath) 

1088 with open(filename, 'rb') as fd: 

1089 default_font = AFM(fd) 

1090 default_font.fname = filename 

1091 

1092 self.fonts['default'] = default_font 

1093 self.fonts['regular'] = default_font 

1094 self.pswriter = StringIO() 

1095 

1096 def _get_font(self, font): 

1097 if font in self.fontmap: 

1098 basename = self.fontmap[font] 

1099 else: 

1100 basename = font 

1101 

1102 cached_font = self.fonts.get(basename) 

1103 if cached_font is None: 

1104 fname = os.path.join(self.basepath, basename + ".afm") 

1105 with open(fname, 'rb') as fd: 

1106 cached_font = AFM(fd) 

1107 cached_font.fname = fname 

1108 self.fonts[basename] = cached_font 

1109 self.fonts[cached_font.get_fontname()] = cached_font 

1110 return cached_font 

1111 

1112 def _get_info(self, fontname, font_class, sym, fontsize, dpi, math=True): 

1113 'load the cmfont, metrics and glyph with caching' 

1114 key = fontname, sym, fontsize, dpi 

1115 tup = self.glyphd.get(key) 

1116 

1117 if tup is not None: 

1118 return tup 

1119 

1120 # Only characters in the "Letter" class should really be italicized. 

1121 # This class includes greek letters, so we're ok 

1122 if (fontname == 'it' and 

1123 (len(sym) > 1 or not unicodedata.category(sym).startswith("L"))): 

1124 fontname = 'rm' 

1125 

1126 found_symbol = False 

1127 

1128 if sym in latex_to_standard: 

1129 fontname, num = latex_to_standard[sym] 

1130 glyph = chr(num) 

1131 found_symbol = True 

1132 elif len(sym) == 1: 

1133 glyph = sym 

1134 num = ord(glyph) 

1135 found_symbol = True 

1136 else: 

1137 warnings.warn( 

1138 "No TeX to built-in Postscript mapping for {!r}".format(sym), 

1139 MathTextWarning) 

1140 

1141 slanted = (fontname == 'it') 

1142 font = self._get_font(fontname) 

1143 

1144 if found_symbol: 

1145 try: 

1146 symbol_name = font.get_name_char(glyph) 

1147 except KeyError: 

1148 warnings.warn( 

1149 "No glyph in standard Postscript font {!r} for {!r}" 

1150 .format(font.get_fontname(), sym), 

1151 MathTextWarning) 

1152 found_symbol = False 

1153 

1154 if not found_symbol: 

1155 glyph = sym = '?' 

1156 num = ord(glyph) 

1157 symbol_name = font.get_name_char(glyph) 

1158 

1159 offset = 0 

1160 

1161 scale = 0.001 * fontsize 

1162 

1163 xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax = [val * scale 

1164 for val in font.get_bbox_char(glyph)] 

1165 metrics = types.SimpleNamespace( 

1166 advance = font.get_width_char(glyph) * scale, 

1167 width = font.get_width_char(glyph) * scale, 

1168 height = font.get_height_char(glyph) * scale, 

1169 xmin = xmin, 

1170 xmax = xmax, 

1171 ymin = ymin+offset, 

1172 ymax = ymax+offset, 

1173 # iceberg is the equivalent of TeX's "height" 

1174 iceberg = ymax + offset, 

1175 slanted = slanted 

1176 ) 

1177 

1178 self.glyphd[key] = types.SimpleNamespace( 

1179 font = font, 

1180 fontsize = fontsize, 

1181 postscript_name = font.get_fontname(), 

1182 metrics = metrics, 

1183 symbol_name = symbol_name, 

1184 num = num, 

1185 glyph = glyph, 

1186 offset = offset 

1187 ) 

1188 

1189 return self.glyphd[key] 

1190 

1191 def get_kern(self, font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, 

1192 font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi): 

1193 if font1 == font2 and fontsize1 == fontsize2: 

1194 info1 = self._get_info(font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, dpi) 

1195 info2 = self._get_info(font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi) 

1196 font = info1.font 

1197 return (font.get_kern_dist(info1.glyph, info2.glyph) 

1198 * 0.001 * fontsize1) 

1199 return Fonts.get_kern(self, font1, fontclass1, sym1, fontsize1, 

1200 font2, fontclass2, sym2, fontsize2, dpi) 

1201 

1202 def get_xheight(self, font, fontsize, dpi): 

1203 font = self._get_font(font) 

1204 return font.get_xheight() * 0.001 * fontsize 

1205 

1206 def get_underline_thickness(self, font, fontsize, dpi): 

1207 font = self._get_font(font) 

1208 return font.get_underline_thickness() * 0.001 * fontsize

1211############################################################################## 

1212# TeX-LIKE BOX MODEL 

1213 

1214# The following is based directly on the document 'woven' from the 

1215# TeX82 source code. This information is also available in printed 

1216# form: 

1217# 

1218# Knuth, Donald E.. 1986. Computers and Typesetting, Volume B: 

1219# TeX: The Program. Addison-Wesley Professional. 

1220# 

1221# The most relevant "chapters" are: 

1222# Data structures for boxes and their friends 

1223# Shipping pages out (Ship class) 

1224# Packaging (hpack and vpack) 

1225# Data structures for math mode 

1226# Subroutines for math mode 

1227# Typesetting math formulas 

1228# 

1229# Many of the docstrings below refer to a numbered "node" in that 

1230# book, e.g., node123 

1231# 

1232# Note that (as TeX) y increases downward, unlike many other parts of 

1233# matplotlib. 

1234 

1235# How much text shrinks when going to the next-smallest level. GROW_FACTOR 

1236# must be the inverse of SHRINK_FACTOR. 

1237SHRINK_FACTOR = 0.7 

1238GROW_FACTOR = 1.0 / SHRINK_FACTOR 

1239# The number of different sizes of chars to use, beyond which they will not 

1240# get any smaller 

1241NUM_SIZE_LEVELS = 6 

1242 

1243 

1244class FontConstantsBase(object): 

1245 """ 

1246 A set of constants that controls how certain things, such as sub- 

1247 and superscripts are laid out. These are all metrics that can't 

1248 be reliably retrieved from the font metrics in the font itself. 

1249 """ 

1250 # Percentage of x-height of additional horiz. space after sub/superscripts 

1251 script_space = 0.05 

1252 

1253 # Percentage of x-height that sub/superscripts drop below the baseline 

1254 subdrop = 0.4 

1255 

1256 # Percentage of x-height that superscripts are raised from the baseline 

1257 sup1 = 0.7 

1258 

1259 # Percentage of x-height that subscripts drop below the baseline 

1260 sub1 = 0.3 

1261 

1262 # Percentage of x-height that subscripts drop below the baseline when a 

1263 # superscript is present 

1264 sub2 = 0.5 

1265 

1266 # Percentage of x-height that sub/supercripts are offset relative to the 

1267 # nucleus edge for non-slanted nuclei 

1268 delta = 0.025 

1269 

1270 # Additional percentage of last character height above 2/3 of the 

1271 # x-height that supercripts are offset relative to the subscript 

1272 # for slanted nuclei 

1273 delta_slanted = 0.2 

1274 

1275 # Percentage of x-height that supercripts and subscripts are offset for 

1276 # integrals 

1277 delta_integral = 0.1 

1278 

1279 

1280class ComputerModernFontConstants(FontConstantsBase): 

1281 script_space = 0.075 

1282 subdrop = 0.2 

1283 sup1 = 0.45 

1284 sub1 = 0.2 

1285 sub2 = 0.3 

1286 delta = 0.075 

1287 delta_slanted = 0.3 

1288 delta_integral = 0.3 

1289 

1290 

1291class STIXFontConstants(FontConstantsBase): 

1292 script_space = 0.1 

1293 sup1 = 0.8 

1294 sub2 = 0.6 

1295 delta = 0.05 

1296 delta_slanted = 0.3 

1297 delta_integral = 0.3 

1298

1301 script_space = 0.05 

1302 sup1 = 0.8 

1303 delta_slanted = 0.6 

1304 delta_integral = 0.3

1315# Maps font family names to the FontConstantBase subclass to use 

1316_font_constant_mapping = { 

1317 'DejaVu Sans': DejaVuSansFontConstants, 

1318 'DejaVu Sans Mono': DejaVuSansFontConstants, 

1319 'DejaVu Serif': DejaVuSerifFontConstants, 

1320 'cmb10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1321 'cmex10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1322 'cmmi10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1323 'cmr10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1324 'cmss10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1325 'cmsy10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1326 'cmtt10': ComputerModernFontConstants, 

1327 'STIXGeneral': STIXFontConstants, 

1328 'STIXNonUnicode': STIXFontConstants, 

1329 'STIXSizeFiveSym': STIXFontConstants, 

1330 'STIXSizeFourSym': STIXFontConstants, 

1331 'STIXSizeThreeSym': STIXFontConstants, 

1332 'STIXSizeTwoSym': STIXFontConstants, 

1333 'STIXSizeOneSym': STIXFontConstants, 

1334 # Map the fonts we used to ship, just for good measure 

1335 'Bitstream Vera Sans': DejaVuSansFontConstants, 

1336 'Bitstream Vera': DejaVuSansFontConstants, 

1337 } 

1338 

1339 

1340def _get_font_constant_set(state): 

1341 constants = _font_constant_mapping.get( 

1342 state.font_output._get_font(state.font).family_name, 

1343 FontConstantsBase) 

1344 # STIX sans isn't really its own fonts, just different code points 

1345 # in the STIX fonts, so we have to detect this one separately. 

1346 if (constants is STIXFontConstants and 

1347 isinstance(state.font_output, StixSansFonts)): 

1348 return STIXSansFontConstants 

1349 return constants

1352class MathTextWarning(Warning): 

1353 pass 

1354 

1355class Node(object): 

1356 """ 

1357 A node in the TeX box model 

1358 """ 

1359 def __init__(self): 

1360 self.size = 0 

1361 

1362 def __repr__(self): 

1363 return self.__class__.__name__ 

1364 

1365 def get_kerning(self, next): 

1366 return 0.0 

1367 

1368 def shrink(self): 

1369 """ 

1370 Shrinks one level smaller. There are only three levels of 

1371 sizes, after which things will no longer get smaller. 

1372 """ 

1373 self.size += 1 

1374 

1375 def grow(self): 

1376 """ 

1377 Grows one level larger. There is no limit to how big 

1378 something can get. 

1379 """ 

1380 self.size -= 1 

1381 

1382 def render(self, x, y): 

1383 pass 

1384 

1385class Box(Node): 

1386 """ 

1387 Represents any node with a physical location. 

1388 """ 

1389 def __init__(self, width, height, depth): 

1390 Node.__init__(self) 

1391 self.width = width 

1392 self.height = height 

1393 self.depth = depth 

1394 

1395 def shrink(self): 

1396 Node.shrink(self) 

1397 if self.size < NUM_SIZE_LEVELS: 

1398 self.width *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1399 self.height *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1400 self.depth *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1401 

1402 def grow(self): 

1403 Node.grow(self) 

1404 self.width *= GROW_FACTOR 

1405 self.height *= GROW_FACTOR 

1406 self.depth *= GROW_FACTOR 

1407 

1408 def render(self, x1, y1, x2, y2): 

1409 pass 

1410 

1411class Vbox(Box): 

1412 """ 

1413 A box with only height (zero width). 

1414 """ 

1415 def __init__(self, height, depth): 

1416 Box.__init__(self, 0., height, depth) 

1417 

1418class Hbox(Box): 

1419 """ 

1420 A box with only width (zero height and depth). 

1421 """ 

1422 def __init__(self, width): 

1423 Box.__init__(self, width, 0., 0.) 

1424 

1425class Char(Node): 

1426 """ 

1427 Represents a single character. Unlike TeX, the font information 

1428 and metrics are stored with each :class:`Char` to make it easier 

1429 to lookup the font metrics when needed. Note that TeX boxes have 

1430 a width, height, and depth, unlike Type1 and Truetype which use a 

1431 full bounding box and an advance in the x-direction. The metrics 

1432 must be converted to the TeX way, and the advance (if different 

1433 from width) must be converted into a :class:`Kern` node when the 

1434 :class:`Char` is added to its parent :class:`Hlist`. 

1435 """ 

1436 def __init__(self, c, state, math=True): 

1437 Node.__init__(self) 

1438 self.c = c 

1439 self.font_output = state.font_output 

1440 self.font = state.font 

1441 self.font_class = state.font_class 

1442 self.fontsize = state.fontsize 

1443 self.dpi = state.dpi 

1444 self.math = math 

1445 # The real width, height and depth will be set during the 

1446 # pack phase, after we know the real fontsize 

1447 self._update_metrics() 

1448 

1449 def __repr__(self): 

1450 return '`%s`' % self.c 

1451 

1452 def _update_metrics(self): 

1453 metrics = self._metrics = self.font_output.get_metrics( 

1454 self.font, self.font_class, self.c, self.fontsize, self.dpi, self.math) 

1455 if self.c == ' ': 

1456 self.width = metrics.advance 

1457 else: 

1458 self.width = metrics.width 

1459 self.height = metrics.iceberg 

1460 self.depth = -(metrics.iceberg - metrics.height) 

1461 

1462 def is_slanted(self): 

1463 return self._metrics.slanted 

1464 

1465 def get_kerning(self, next): 

1466 """ 

1467 Return the amount of kerning between this and the given 

1468 character. Called when characters are strung together into 

1469 :class:`Hlist` to create :class:`Kern` nodes. 

1470 """ 

1471 advance = self._metrics.advance - self.width 

1472 kern = 0. 

1473 if isinstance(next, Char): 

1474 kern = self.font_output.get_kern( 

1475 self.font, self.font_class, self.c, self.fontsize, 

1476 next.font, next.font_class, next.c, next.fontsize, 

1477 self.dpi) 

1478 return advance + kern 

1479 

1480 def render(self, x, y): 

1481 """ 

1482 Render the character to the canvas 

1483 """ 

1484 self.font_output.render_glyph( 

1485 x, y, 

1486 self.font, self.font_class, self.c, self.fontsize, self.dpi) 

1487 

1488 def shrink(self): 

1489 Node.shrink(self) 

1490 if self.size < NUM_SIZE_LEVELS: 

1491 self.fontsize *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1492 self.width *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1493 self.height *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1494 self.depth *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1495 

1496 def grow(self): 

1497 Node.grow(self) 

1498 self.fontsize *= GROW_FACTOR 

1499 self.width *= GROW_FACTOR 

1500 self.height *= GROW_FACTOR 

1501 self.depth *= GROW_FACTOR 

1502 

1503class Accent(Char): 

1504 """ 

1505 The font metrics need to be dealt with differently for accents, 

1506 since they are already offset correctly from the baseline in 

1507 TrueType fonts. 

1508 """ 

1509 def _update_metrics(self): 

1510 metrics = self._metrics = self.font_output.get_metrics( 

1511 self.font, self.font_class, self.c, self.fontsize, self.dpi) 

1512 self.width = metrics.xmax - metrics.xmin 

1513 self.height = metrics.ymax - metrics.ymin 

1514 self.depth = 0 

1515 

1516 def shrink(self): 

1517 Char.shrink(self) 

1518 self._update_metrics() 

1519 

1520 def grow(self): 

1521 Char.grow(self) 

1522 self._update_metrics() 

1523 

1524 def render(self, x, y): 

1525 """ 

1526 Render the character to the canvas. 

1527 """ 

1528 self.font_output.render_glyph( 

1529 x - self._metrics.xmin, y + self._metrics.ymin, 

1530 self.font, self.font_class, self.c, self.fontsize, self.dpi) 

1531 

1532class List(Box): 

1533 """ 

1534 A list of nodes (either horizontal or vertical). 

1535 """ 

1536 def __init__(self, elements): 

1537 Box.__init__(self, 0., 0., 0.) 

1538 self.shift_amount = 0. # An arbitrary offset 

1539 self.children = elements # The child nodes of this list 

1540 # The following parameters are set in the vpack and hpack functions 

1541 self.glue_set = 0. # The glue setting of this list 

1542 self.glue_sign = 0 # 0: normal, -1: shrinking, 1: stretching 

1543 self.glue_order = 0 # The order of infinity (0 - 3) for the glue 

1544 

1545 def __repr__(self): 

1546 return '[%s <%.02f %.02f %.02f %.02f> %s]' % ( 

1547 super().__repr__(), 

1548 self.width, self.height, 

1549 self.depth, self.shift_amount, 

1550 ' '.join([repr(x) for x in self.children])) 

1551 

1552 @staticmethod 

1553 def _determine_order(totals): 

1554 """ 

1555 Determine the highest order of glue used by the members of this list. 

1556 

1557 Helper function used by vpack and hpack. 

1558 """ 

1559 for i in range(len(totals))[::-1]: 

1560 if totals[i] != 0: 

1561 return i 

1562 return 0 

1563 

1564 def _set_glue(self, x, sign, totals, error_type): 

1565 o = self._determine_order(totals) 

1566 self.glue_order = o 

1567 self.glue_sign = sign 

1568 if totals[o] != 0.: 

1569 self.glue_set = x / totals[o] 

1570 else: 

1571 self.glue_sign = 0 

1572 self.glue_ratio = 0. 

1573 if o == 0: 

1574 if len(self.children): 

1575 warnings.warn( 

1576 "%s %s: %r" % (error_type, self.__class__.__name__, self), 

1577 MathTextWarning) 

1578 

1579 def shrink(self): 

1580 for child in self.children: 

1581 child.shrink() 

1582 Box.shrink(self) 

1583 if self.size < NUM_SIZE_LEVELS: 

1584 self.shift_amount *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1585 self.glue_set *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1586 

1587 def grow(self): 

1588 for child in self.children: 

1589 child.grow() 

1590 Box.grow(self) 

1591 self.shift_amount *= GROW_FACTOR 

1592 self.glue_set *= GROW_FACTOR 

1593 

1594class Hlist(List): 

1595 """ 

1596 A horizontal list of boxes. 

1597 """ 

1598 def __init__(self, elements, w=0., m='additional', do_kern=True): 

1599 List.__init__(self, elements) 

1600 if do_kern: 

1601 self.kern() 

1602 self.hpack() 

1603 

1604 def kern(self): 

1605 """ 

1606 Insert :class:`Kern` nodes between :class:`Char` nodes to set 

1607 kerning. The :class:`Char` nodes themselves determine the 

1608 amount of kerning they need (in :meth:`~Char.get_kerning`), 

1609 and this function just creates the linked list in the correct 

1610 way. 

1611 """ 

1612 new_children = [] 

1613 num_children = len(self.children) 

1614 if num_children: 

1615 for i in range(num_children): 

1616 elem = self.children[i] 

1617 if i < num_children - 1: 

1618 next = self.children[i + 1] 

1619 else: 

1620 next = None 

1621 

1622 new_children.append(elem) 

1623 kerning_distance = elem.get_kerning(next) 

1624 if kerning_distance != 0.: 

1625 kern = Kern(kerning_distance) 

1626 new_children.append(kern) 

1627 self.children = new_children 

1628 

1629 # This is a failed experiment to fake cross-font kerning. 

1630# def get_kerning(self, next): 

1631# if len(self.children) >= 2 and isinstance(self.children[-2], Char): 

1632# if isinstance(next, Char): 

1633# print "CASE A" 

1634# return self.children[-2].get_kerning(next) 

1635# elif isinstance(next, Hlist) and len(next.children) and isinstance(next.children[0], Char): 

1636# print "CASE B" 

1637# result = self.children[-2].get_kerning(next.children[0]) 

1638# print result 

1639# return result 

1640# return 0.0 

1641 

1642 def hpack(self, w=0., m='additional'): 

1643 """ 

1644 The main duty of :meth:`hpack` is to compute the dimensions of 

1645 the resulting boxes, and to adjust the glue if one of those 

1646 dimensions is pre-specified. The computed sizes normally 

1647 enclose all of the material inside the new box; but some items 

1648 may stick out if negative glue is used, if the box is 

1649 overfull, or if a ``\\vbox`` includes other boxes that have 

1650 been shifted left. 

1651 

1652 - *w*: specifies a width 

1653 

1654 - *m*: is either 'exactly' or 'additional'. 

1655 

1656 Thus, ``hpack(w, 'exactly')`` produces a box whose width is 

1657 exactly *w*, while ``hpack(w, 'additional')`` yields a box 

1658 whose width is the natural width plus *w*. The default values 

1659 produce a box with the natural width. 

1660 """ 

1661 # I don't know why these get reset in TeX. Shift_amount is pretty 

1662 # much useless if we do. 

1663 #self.shift_amount = 0. 

1664 h = 0. 

1665 d = 0. 

1666 x = 0. 

1667 total_stretch = [0.] * 4 

1668 total_shrink = [0.] * 4 

1669 for p in self.children: 

1670 if isinstance(p, Char): 

1671 x += p.width 

1672 h = max(h, p.height) 

1673 d = max(d, p.depth) 

1674 elif isinstance(p, Box): 

1675 x += p.width 

1676 if not np.isinf(p.height) and not np.isinf(p.depth): 

1677 s = getattr(p, 'shift_amount', 0.) 

1678 h = max(h, p.height - s) 

1679 d = max(d, p.depth + s) 

1680 elif isinstance(p, Glue): 

1681 glue_spec = p.glue_spec 

1682 x += glue_spec.width 

1683 total_stretch[glue_spec.stretch_order] += glue_spec.stretch 

1684 total_shrink[glue_spec.shrink_order] += glue_spec.shrink 

1685 elif isinstance(p, Kern): 

1686 x += p.width 

1687 self.height = h 

1688 self.depth = d 

1689 

1690 if m == 'additional': 

1691 w += x 

1692 self.width = w 

1693 x = w - x 

1694 

1695 if x == 0.: 

1696 self.glue_sign = 0 

1697 self.glue_order = 0 

1698 self.glue_ratio = 0. 

1699 return 

1700 if x > 0.: 

1701 self._set_glue(x, 1, total_stretch, "Overfull") 

1702 else: 

1703 self._set_glue(x, -1, total_shrink, "Underfull") 

1704 

1705class Vlist(List): 

1706 """ 

1707 A vertical list of boxes. 

1708 """ 

1709 def __init__(self, elements, h=0., m='additional'): 

1710 List.__init__(self, elements) 

1711 self.vpack() 

1712 

1713 def vpack(self, h=0., m='additional', l=np.inf): 

1714 """ 

1715 The main duty of :meth:`vpack` is to compute the dimensions of 

1716 the resulting boxes, and to adjust the glue if one of those 

1717 dimensions is pre-specified. 

1718 

1719 - *h*: specifies a height 

1720 - *m*: is either 'exactly' or 'additional'. 

1721 - *l*: a maximum height 

1722 

1723 Thus, ``vpack(h, 'exactly')`` produces a box whose height is 

1724 exactly *h*, while ``vpack(h, 'additional')`` yields a box 

1725 whose height is the natural height plus *h*. The default 

1726 values produce a box with the natural width. 

1727 """ 

1728 # I don't know why these get reset in TeX. Shift_amount is pretty 

1729 # much useless if we do. 

1730 # self.shift_amount = 0. 

1731 w = 0. 

1732 d = 0. 

1733 x = 0. 

1734 total_stretch = [0.] * 4 

1735 total_shrink = [0.] * 4 

1736 for p in self.children: 

1737 if isinstance(p, Box): 

1738 x += d + p.height 

1739 d = p.depth 

1740 if not np.isinf(p.width): 

1741 s = getattr(p, 'shift_amount', 0.) 

1742 w = max(w, p.width + s) 

1743 elif isinstance(p, Glue): 

1744 x += d 

1745 d = 0. 

1746 glue_spec = p.glue_spec 

1747 x += glue_spec.width 

1748 total_stretch[glue_spec.stretch_order] += glue_spec.stretch 

1749 total_shrink[glue_spec.shrink_order] += glue_spec.shrink 

1750 elif isinstance(p, Kern): 

1751 x += d + p.width 

1752 d = 0. 

1753 elif isinstance(p, Char): 

1754 raise RuntimeError("Internal mathtext error: Char node found in Vlist.") 

1755 

1756 self.width = w 

1757 if d > l: 

1758 x += d - l 

1759 self.depth = l 

1760 else: 

1761 self.depth = d 

1762 

1763 if m == 'additional': 

1764 h += x 

1765 self.height = h 

1766 x = h - x 

1767 

1768 if x == 0: 

1769 self.glue_sign = 0 

1770 self.glue_order = 0 

1771 self.glue_ratio = 0. 

1772 return 

1773 

1774 if x > 0.: 

1775 self._set_glue(x, 1, total_stretch, "Overfull") 

1776 else: 

1777 self._set_glue(x, -1, total_shrink, "Underfull") 

1778 

1779class Rule(Box): 

1780 """ 

1781 A :class:`Rule` node stands for a solid black rectangle; it has 

1782 *width*, *depth*, and *height* fields just as in an 

1783 :class:`Hlist`. However, if any of these dimensions is inf, the 

1784 actual value will be determined by running the rule up to the 

1785 boundary of the innermost enclosing box. This is called a "running 

1786 dimension." The width is never running in an :class:`Hlist`; the 

1787 height and depth are never running in a :class:`Vlist`. 

1788 """ 

1789 def __init__(self, width, height, depth, state): 

1790 Box.__init__(self, width, height, depth) 

1791 self.font_output = state.font_output 

1792 

1793 def render(self, x, y, w, h): 

1794 self.font_output.render_rect_filled(x, y, x + w, y + h) 

1795 

1796class Hrule(Rule): 

1797 """ 

1798 Convenience class to create a horizontal rule. 

1799 """ 

1800 def __init__(self, state, thickness=None): 

1801 if thickness is None: 

1802 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

1803 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

1804 height = depth = thickness * 0.5 

1805 Rule.__init__(self, np.inf, height, depth, state) 

1806 

1807class Vrule(Rule): 

1808 """ 

1809 Convenience class to create a vertical rule. 

1810 """ 

1811 def __init__(self, state): 

1812 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

1813 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

1814 Rule.__init__(self, thickness, np.inf, np.inf, state) 

1815 

1816class Glue(Node): 

1817 """ 

1818 Most of the information in this object is stored in the underlying 

1819 :class:`GlueSpec` class, which is shared between multiple glue objects. 

1820 (This is a memory optimization which probably doesn't matter anymore, but 

1821 it's easier to stick to what TeX does.) 

1822 """ 

1823 def __init__(self, glue_type, copy=False): 

1824 Node.__init__(self) 

1825 self.glue_subtype = 'normal' 

1826 if isinstance(glue_type, str): 

1827 glue_spec = GlueSpec.factory(glue_type) 

1828 elif isinstance(glue_type, GlueSpec): 

1829 glue_spec = glue_type 

1830 else: 

1831 raise ValueError("glue_type must be a glue spec name or instance") 

1832 if copy: 

1833 glue_spec = glue_spec.copy() 

1834 self.glue_spec = glue_spec 

1835 

1836 def shrink(self): 

1837 Node.shrink(self) 

1838 if self.size < NUM_SIZE_LEVELS: 

1839 if self.glue_spec.width != 0.: 

1840 self.glue_spec = self.glue_spec.copy() 

1841 self.glue_spec.width *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1842 

1843 def grow(self): 

1844 Node.grow(self) 

1845 if self.glue_spec.width != 0.: 

1846 self.glue_spec = self.glue_spec.copy() 

1847 self.glue_spec.width *= GROW_FACTOR 

1848 

1849class GlueSpec(object): 

1850 """ 

1851 See :class:`Glue`. 

1852 """ 

1853 def __init__(self, width=0., stretch=0., stretch_order=0, shrink=0., shrink_order=0): 

1854 self.width = width 

1855 self.stretch = stretch 

1856 self.stretch_order = stretch_order 

1857 self.shrink = shrink 

1858 self.shrink_order = shrink_order 

1859 

1860 def copy(self): 

1861 return GlueSpec( 

1862 self.width, 

1863 self.stretch, 

1864 self.stretch_order, 

1865 self.shrink, 

1866 self.shrink_order) 

1867 

1868 def factory(cls, glue_type): 

1869 return cls._types[glue_type] 

1870 factory = classmethod(factory) 

1871 

1872GlueSpec._types = { 

1873 'fil': GlueSpec(0., 1., 1, 0., 0), 

1874 'fill': GlueSpec(0., 1., 2, 0., 0), 

1875 'filll': GlueSpec(0., 1., 3, 0., 0), 

1876 'neg_fil': GlueSpec(0., 0., 0, 1., 1), 

1877 'neg_fill': GlueSpec(0., 0., 0, 1., 2), 

1878 'neg_filll': GlueSpec(0., 0., 0, 1., 3), 

1879 'empty': GlueSpec(0., 0., 0, 0., 0), 

1880 'ss': GlueSpec(0., 1., 1, -1., 1) 

1881} 

1882 

1883# Some convenient ways to get common kinds of glue 

1884

1916 centered within its enclosing box.

1930class Kern(Node): 

1931 """ 

1932 A :class:`Kern` node has a width field to specify a (normally 

1933 negative) amount of spacing. This spacing correction appears in 

1934 horizontal lists between letters like A and V when the font 

1935 designer said that it looks better to move them closer together or 

1936 further apart. A kern node can also appear in a vertical list, 

1937 when its *width* denotes additional spacing in the vertical 

1938 direction. 

1939 """ 

1940 height = 0 

1941 depth = 0 

1942 

1943 def __init__(self, width): 

1944 Node.__init__(self) 

1945 self.width = width 

1946 

1947 def __repr__(self): 

1948 return "k%.02f" % self.width 

1949 

1950 def shrink(self): 

1951 Node.shrink(self) 

1952 if self.size < NUM_SIZE_LEVELS: 

1953 self.width *= SHRINK_FACTOR 

1954 

1955 def grow(self): 

1956 Node.grow(self) 

1957 self.width *= GROW_FACTOR 

1958 

1959class SubSuperCluster(Hlist): 

1960 """ 

1961 :class:`SubSuperCluster` is a sort of hack to get around that fact 

1962 that this code do a two-pass parse like TeX. This lets us store 

1963 enough information in the hlist itself, namely the nucleus, sub- 

1964 and super-script, such that if another script follows that needs 

1965 to be attached, it can be reconfigured on the fly. 

1966 """ 

1967 def __init__(self): 

1968 self.nucleus = None 

1969 self.sub = None 

1970 self.super = None 

1971 Hlist.__init__(self, []) 

1972 

1973class AutoHeightChar(Hlist): 

1974 """ 

1975 :class:`AutoHeightChar` will create a character as close to the 

1976 given height and depth as possible. When using a font with 

1977 multiple height versions of some characters (such as the BaKoMa 

1978 fonts), the correct glyph will be selected, otherwise this will 

1979 always just return a scaled version of the glyph. 

1980 """ 

1981 def __init__(self, c, height, depth, state, always=False, factor=None): 

1982 alternatives = state.font_output.get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol( 

1983 state.font, c) 

1984 

1985 xHeight = state.font_output.get_xheight( 

1986 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

1987 

1988 state = state.copy() 

1989 target_total = height + depth 

1990 for fontname, sym in alternatives: 

1991 state.font = fontname 

1992 char = Char(sym, state) 

1993 # Ensure that size 0 is chosen when the text is regular sized but 

1994 # with descender glyphs by subtracting 0.2 * xHeight 

1995 if char.height + char.depth >= target_total - 0.2 * xHeight: 

1996 break 

1997 

1998 shift = 0 

1999 if state.font != 0: 

2000 if factor is None: 

2001 factor = (target_total) / (char.height + char.depth) 

2002 state.fontsize *= factor 

2003 char = Char(sym, state) 

2004 

2005 shift = (depth - char.depth) 

2006 

2007 Hlist.__init__(self, [char]) 

2008 self.shift_amount = shift 

2009 

2010class AutoWidthChar(Hlist): 

2011 """ 

2012 :class:`AutoWidthChar` will create a character as close to the 

2013 given width as possible. When using a font with multiple width 

2014 versions of some characters (such as the BaKoMa fonts), the 

2015 correct glyph will be selected, otherwise this will always just 

2016 return a scaled version of the glyph. 

2017 """ 

2018 def __init__(self, c, width, state, always=False, char_class=Char): 

2019 alternatives = state.font_output.get_sized_alternatives_for_symbol( 

2020 state.font, c) 

2021 

2022 state = state.copy() 

2023 for fontname, sym in alternatives: 

2024 state.font = fontname 

2025 char = char_class(sym, state) 

2026 if char.width >= width: 

2027 break 

2028 

2029 factor = width / char.width 

2030 state.fontsize *= factor 

2031 char = char_class(sym, state) 

2032 

2033 Hlist.__init__(self, [char]) 

2034 self.width = char.width 

2035 

2036 

2037class Ship(object): 

2038 """ 

2039 Once the boxes have been set up, this sends them to output. Since 

2040 boxes can be inside of boxes inside of boxes, the main work of 

2041 :class:`Ship` is done by two mutually recursive routines, 

2042 :meth:`hlist_out` and :meth:`vlist_out`, which traverse the 

2043 :class:`Hlist` nodes and :class:`Vlist` nodes inside of horizontal 

2044 and vertical boxes. The global variables used in TeX to store 

2045 state as it processes have become member variables here. 

2046 """ 

2047 def __call__(self, ox, oy, box): 

2048 self.max_push = 0 # Deepest nesting of push commands so far 

2049 self.cur_s = 0 

2050 self.cur_v = 0. 

2051 self.cur_h = 0. 

2052 self.off_h = ox 

2053 self.off_v = oy + box.height 

2054 self.hlist_out(box) 

2055 

2056 def clamp(value): 

2057 if value < -1000000000.: 

2058 return -1000000000. 

2059 if value > 1000000000.: 

2060 return 1000000000. 

2061 return value 

2062 clamp = staticmethod(clamp) 

2063 

2064 def hlist_out(self, box): 

2065 cur_g = 0 

2066 cur_glue = 0. 

2067 glue_order = box.glue_order 

2068 glue_sign = box.glue_sign 

2069 base_line = self.cur_v 

2070 left_edge = self.cur_h 

2071 self.cur_s += 1 

2072 self.max_push = max(self.cur_s, self.max_push) 

2073 clamp = self.clamp 

2074 

2075 for p in box.children: 

2076 if isinstance(p, Char): 

2077 p.render(self.cur_h + self.off_h, self.cur_v + self.off_v) 

2078 self.cur_h += p.width 

2079 elif isinstance(p, Kern): 

2080 self.cur_h += p.width 

2081 elif isinstance(p, List): 

2082 # node623 

2083 if len(p.children) == 0: 

2084 self.cur_h += p.width 

2085 else: 

2086 edge = self.cur_h 

2087 self.cur_v = base_line + p.shift_amount 

2088 if isinstance(p, Hlist): 

2089 self.hlist_out(p) 

2090 else: 

2091 # p.vpack(box.height + box.depth, 'exactly') 

2092 self.vlist_out(p) 

2093 self.cur_h = edge + p.width 

2094 self.cur_v = base_line 

2095 elif isinstance(p, Box): 

2096 # node624 

2097 rule_height = p.height 

2098 rule_depth = p.depth 

2099 rule_width = p.width 

2100 if np.isinf(rule_height): 

2101 rule_height = box.height 

2102 if np.isinf(rule_depth): 

2103 rule_depth = box.depth 

2104 if rule_height > 0 and rule_width > 0: 

2105 self.cur_v = base_line + rule_depth 

2106 p.render(self.cur_h + self.off_h, 

2107 self.cur_v + self.off_v, 

2108 rule_width, rule_height) 

2109 self.cur_v = base_line 

2110 self.cur_h += rule_width 

2111 elif isinstance(p, Glue): 

2112 # node625 

2113 glue_spec = p.glue_spec 

2114 rule_width = glue_spec.width - cur_g 

2115 if glue_sign != 0: # normal 

2116 if glue_sign == 1: # stretching 

2117 if glue_spec.stretch_order == glue_order: 

2118 cur_glue += glue_spec.stretch 

2119 cur_g = np.round(clamp(float(box.glue_set) * cur_glue)) 

2120 elif glue_spec.shrink_order == glue_order: 

2121 cur_glue += glue_spec.shrink 

2122 cur_g = np.round(clamp(float(box.glue_set) * cur_glue)) 

2123 rule_width += cur_g 

2124 self.cur_h += rule_width 

2125 self.cur_s -= 1 

2126 

2127 def vlist_out(self, box): 

2128 cur_g = 0 

2129 cur_glue = 0. 

2130 glue_order = box.glue_order 

2131 glue_sign = box.glue_sign 

2132 self.cur_s += 1 

2133 self.max_push = max(self.max_push, self.cur_s) 

2134 left_edge = self.cur_h 

2135 self.cur_v -= box.height 

2136 top_edge = self.cur_v 

2137 clamp = self.clamp 

2138 

2139 for p in box.children: 

2140 if isinstance(p, Kern): 

2141 self.cur_v += p.width 

2142 elif isinstance(p, List): 

2143 if len(p.children) == 0: 

2144 self.cur_v += p.height + p.depth 

2145 else: 

2146 self.cur_v += p.height 

2147 self.cur_h = left_edge + p.shift_amount 

2148 save_v = self.cur_v 

2149 p.width = box.width 

2150 if isinstance(p, Hlist): 

2151 self.hlist_out(p) 

2152 else: 

2153 self.vlist_out(p) 

2154 self.cur_v = save_v + p.depth 

2155 self.cur_h = left_edge 

2156 elif isinstance(p, Box): 

2157 rule_height = p.height 

2158 rule_depth = p.depth 

2159 rule_width = p.width 

2160 if np.isinf(rule_width): 

2161 rule_width = box.width 

2162 rule_height += rule_depth 

2163 if rule_height > 0 and rule_depth > 0: 

2164 self.cur_v += rule_height 

2165 p.render(self.cur_h + self.off_h, 

2166 self.cur_v + self.off_v, 

2167 rule_width, rule_height) 

2168 elif isinstance(p, Glue): 

2169 glue_spec = p.glue_spec 

2170 rule_height = glue_spec.width - cur_g 

2171 if glue_sign != 0: # normal 

2172 if glue_sign == 1: # stretching 

2173 if glue_spec.stretch_order == glue_order: 

2174 cur_glue += glue_spec.stretch 

2175 cur_g = np.round(clamp(float(box.glue_set) * cur_glue)) 

2176 elif glue_spec.shrink_order == glue_order: # shrinking 

2177 cur_glue += glue_spec.shrink 

2178 cur_g = np.round(clamp(float(box.glue_set) * cur_glue)) 

2179 rule_height += cur_g 

2180 self.cur_v += rule_height 

2181 elif isinstance(p, Char): 

2182 raise RuntimeError("Internal mathtext error: Char node found in vlist") 

2183 self.cur_s -= 1 

2184 

2185 

2186ship = Ship() 

2187
