2191def Error(msg): 

2192 """ 

2193 Helper class to raise parser errors. 

2194 """ 

2195 def raise_error(s, loc, toks): 

2196 raise ParseFatalException(s, loc, msg) 

2197 

2198 empty = Empty() 

2199 empty.setParseAction(raise_error) 

2200 return empty 

2201 

2202class Parser(object): 

2203 """ 

2204 This is the pyparsing-based parser for math expressions. It 

2205 actually parses full strings *containing* math expressions, in 

2206 that raw text may also appear outside of pairs of ``$``. 

2207 

2208 The grammar is based directly on that in TeX, though it cuts a few 

2209 corners. 

2210 """ 

2211 

2212 _math_style_dict = dict(displaystyle=0, textstyle=1, 

2213 scriptstyle=2, scriptscriptstyle=3) 

2214 

2215 _binary_operators = set(''' 

2216 + * - 

2217 \\pm \\sqcap \\rhd 

2218 \\mp \\sqcup \\unlhd 

2219 \\times \\vee \\unrhd 

2220 \\div \\wedge \\oplus 

2221 \\ast \\setminus \\ominus 

2222 \\star \\wr \\otimes 

2223 \\circ \\diamond \\oslash 

2224 \\bullet \\bigtriangleup \\odot 

2225 \\cdot \\bigtriangledown \\bigcirc 

2226 \\cap \\triangleleft \\dagger 

2227 \\cup \\triangleright \\ddagger 

2228 \\uplus \\lhd \\amalg'''.split()) 

2229 

2230 _relation_symbols = set(''' 

2231 = < > : 

2232 \\leq \\geq \\equiv \\models 

2233 \\prec \\succ \\sim \\perp 

2234 \\preceq \\succeq \\simeq \\mid 

2235 \\ll \\gg \\asymp \\parallel 

2236 \\subset \\supset \\approx \\bowtie 

2237 \\subseteq \\supseteq \\cong \\Join 

2238 \\sqsubset \\sqsupset \\neq \\smile 

2239 \\sqsubseteq \\sqsupseteq \\doteq \\frown 

2240 \\in \\ni \\propto \\vdash 

2241 \\dashv \\dots \\dotplus \\doteqdot'''.split()) 

2242 

2243 _arrow_symbols = set(''' 

2244 \\leftarrow \\longleftarrow \\uparrow 

2245 \\Leftarrow \\Longleftarrow \\Uparrow 

2246 \\rightarrow \\longrightarrow \\downarrow 

2247 \\Rightarrow \\Longrightarrow \\Downarrow 

2248 \\leftrightarrow \\longleftrightarrow \\updownarrow 

2249 \\Leftrightarrow \\Longleftrightarrow \\Updownarrow 

2250 \\mapsto \\longmapsto \\nearrow 

2251 \\hookleftarrow \\hookrightarrow \\searrow 

2252 \\leftharpoonup \\rightharpoonup \\swarrow 

2253 \\leftharpoondown \\rightharpoondown \\nwarrow 

2254 \\rightleftharpoons \\leadsto'''.split()) 

2255 

2256 _spaced_symbols = _binary_operators | _relation_symbols | _arrow_symbols 

2257 

2258 _punctuation_symbols = set(r', ; . ! \ldotp \cdotp'.split()) 

2259 

2260 _overunder_symbols = set(r''' 

2261 \sum \prod \coprod \bigcap \bigcup \bigsqcup \bigvee 

2262 \bigwedge \bigodot \bigotimes \bigoplus \biguplus 

2263 '''.split()) 

2264 

2265 _overunder_functions = set( 

2266 r"lim liminf limsup sup max min".split()) 

2267 

2268 _dropsub_symbols = set(r'''\int \oint'''.split()) 

2269 

2270 _fontnames = set("rm cal it tt sf bf default bb frak circled scr regular".split()) 

2271 

2272 _function_names = set(""" 

2273 arccos csc ker min arcsin deg lg Pr arctan det lim sec arg dim 

2274 liminf sin cos exp limsup sinh cosh gcd ln sup cot hom log tan 

2275 coth inf max tanh""".split()) 

2276 

2277 _ambi_delim = set(""" 

2278 | \\| / \\backslash \\uparrow \\downarrow \\updownarrow \\Uparrow 

2279 \\Downarrow \\Updownarrow . \\vert \\Vert \\\\|""".split()) 

2280 

2281 _left_delim = set(r"( [ \{ < \lfloor \langle \lceil".split()) 

2282 

2283 _right_delim = set(r") ] \} > \rfloor \rangle \rceil".split()) 

2284 

2285 def __init__(self): 

2286 p = types.SimpleNamespace() 

2287 # All forward declarations are here 

2288 p.accent = Forward() 

2289 p.ambi_delim = Forward() 

2290 p.apostrophe = Forward() 

2291 p.auto_delim = Forward() 

2292 p.binom = Forward() 

2293 p.bslash = Forward() 

2294 p.c_over_c = Forward() 

2295 p.customspace = Forward() 

2296 p.end_group = Forward() 

2297 p.float_literal = Forward() 

2298 p.font = Forward() 

2299 p.frac = Forward() 

2300 p.dfrac = Forward() 

2301 p.function = Forward() 

2302 p.genfrac = Forward() 

2303 p.group = Forward() 

2304 p.int_literal = Forward() 

2305 p.latexfont = Forward() 

2306 p.lbracket = Forward() 

2307 p.left_delim = Forward() 

2308 p.lbrace = Forward() 

2309 p.main = Forward() 

2310 p.math = Forward() 

2311 p.math_string = Forward() 

2312 p.non_math = Forward() 

2313 p.operatorname = Forward() 

2314 p.overline = Forward() 

2315 p.placeable = Forward() 

2316 p.rbrace = Forward() 

2317 p.rbracket = Forward() 

2318 p.required_group = Forward() 

2319 p.right_delim = Forward() 

2320 p.right_delim_safe = Forward() 

2321 p.simple = Forward() 

2322 p.simple_group = Forward() 

2323 p.single_symbol = Forward() 

2324 p.snowflake = Forward() 

2325 p.space = Forward() 

2326 p.sqrt = Forward() 

2327 p.stackrel = Forward() 

2328 p.start_group = Forward() 

2329 p.subsuper = Forward() 

2330 p.subsuperop = Forward() 

2331 p.symbol = Forward() 

2332 p.symbol_name = Forward() 

2333 p.token = Forward() 

2334 p.unknown_symbol = Forward() 

2335 

2336 # Set names on everything -- very useful for debugging 

2337 for key, val in vars(p).items(): 

2338 if not key.startswith('_'): 

2339 val.setName(key) 

2340 

2341 p.float_literal <<= Regex(r"[-+]?([0-9]+\.?[0-9]*|\.[0-9]+)") 

2342 p.int_literal <<= Regex("[-+]?[0-9]+") 

2343 

2344 p.lbrace <<= Literal('{').suppress() 

2345 p.rbrace <<= Literal('}').suppress() 

2346 p.lbracket <<= Literal('[').suppress() 

2347 p.rbracket <<= Literal(']').suppress() 

2348 p.bslash <<= Literal('\\') 

2349 

2350 p.space <<= oneOf(list(self._space_widths)) 

2351 p.customspace <<= (Suppress(Literal(r'\hspace')) 

2352 - ((p.lbrace + p.float_literal + p.rbrace) 

2353 | Error(r"Expected \hspace{n}"))) 

2354 

2355 unicode_range = "\U00000080-\U0001ffff" 

2356 p.single_symbol <<= Regex(r"([a-zA-Z0-9 +\-*/<>=:,.;!\?&'@()\[\]|%s])|(\\[%%${}\[\]_|])" % 

2357 unicode_range) 

2358 p.snowflake <<= Suppress(p.bslash) + oneOf(self._snowflake) 

2359 p.symbol_name <<= (Combine(p.bslash + oneOf(list(tex2uni))) + 

2360 FollowedBy(Regex("[^A-Za-z]").leaveWhitespace() | StringEnd())) 

2361 p.symbol <<= (p.single_symbol | p.symbol_name).leaveWhitespace() 

2362 

2363 p.apostrophe <<= Regex("'+") 

2364 

2365 p.c_over_c <<= Suppress(p.bslash) + oneOf(list(self._char_over_chars)) 

2366 

2367 p.accent <<= Group( 

2368 Suppress(p.bslash) 

2369 + oneOf([*self._accent_map, *self._wide_accents]) 

2370 - p.placeable 

2371 ) 

2372 

2373 p.function <<= Suppress(p.bslash) + oneOf(list(self._function_names)) 

2374 

2375 p.start_group <<= Optional(p.latexfont) + p.lbrace 

2376 p.end_group <<= p.rbrace.copy() 

2377 p.simple_group <<= Group(p.lbrace + ZeroOrMore(p.token) + p.rbrace) 

2378 p.required_group<<= Group(p.lbrace + OneOrMore(p.token) + p.rbrace) 

2379 p.group <<= Group(p.start_group + ZeroOrMore(p.token) + p.end_group) 

2380 

2381 p.font <<= Suppress(p.bslash) + oneOf(list(self._fontnames)) 

2382 p.latexfont <<= Suppress(p.bslash) + oneOf(['math' + x for x in self._fontnames]) 

2383 

2384 p.frac <<= Group( 

2385 Suppress(Literal(r"\frac")) 

2386 - ((p.required_group + p.required_group) | Error(r"Expected \frac{num}{den}")) 

2387 ) 

2388 

2389 p.dfrac <<= Group( 

2390 Suppress(Literal(r"\dfrac")) 

2391 - ((p.required_group + p.required_group) | Error(r"Expected \dfrac{num}{den}")) 

2392 ) 

2393 

2394 p.stackrel <<= Group( 

2395 Suppress(Literal(r"\stackrel")) 

2396 - ((p.required_group + p.required_group) | Error(r"Expected \stackrel{num}{den}")) 

2397 ) 

2398 

2399 p.binom <<= Group( 

2400 Suppress(Literal(r"\binom")) 

2401 - ((p.required_group + p.required_group) | Error(r"Expected \binom{num}{den}")) 

2402 ) 

2403 

2404 p.ambi_delim <<= oneOf(list(self._ambi_delim)) 

2405 p.left_delim <<= oneOf(list(self._left_delim)) 

2406 p.right_delim <<= oneOf(list(self._right_delim)) 

2407 p.right_delim_safe <<= oneOf([*(self._right_delim - {'}'}), r'\}']) 

2408 

2409 p.genfrac <<= Group( 

2410 Suppress(Literal(r"\genfrac")) 

2411 - (((p.lbrace + Optional(p.ambi_delim | p.left_delim, default='') + p.rbrace) 

2412 + (p.lbrace + Optional(p.ambi_delim | p.right_delim_safe, default='') + p.rbrace) 

2413 + (p.lbrace + p.float_literal + p.rbrace) 

2414 + p.simple_group + p.required_group + p.required_group) 

2415 | Error(r"Expected \genfrac{ldelim}{rdelim}{rulesize}{style}{num}{den}")) 

2416 ) 

2417 

2418 p.sqrt <<= Group( 

2419 Suppress(Literal(r"\sqrt")) 

2420 - ((Optional(p.lbracket + p.int_literal + p.rbracket, default=None) 

2421 + p.required_group) 

2422 | Error("Expected \\sqrt{value}")) 

2423 ) 

2424 

2425 p.overline <<= Group( 

2426 Suppress(Literal(r"\overline")) 

2427 - (p.required_group | Error("Expected \\overline{value}")) 

2428 ) 

2429 

2430 p.unknown_symbol<<= Combine(p.bslash + Regex("[A-Za-z]*")) 

2431 

2432 p.operatorname <<= Group( 

2433 Suppress(Literal(r"\operatorname")) 

2434 - ((p.lbrace + ZeroOrMore(p.simple | p.unknown_symbol) + p.rbrace) 

2435 | Error("Expected \\operatorname{value}")) 

2436 ) 

2437 

2438 p.placeable <<= ( p.snowflake # this needs to be before accent so named symbols 

2439 # that are prefixed with an accent name work 

2440 | p.accent # Must be before symbol as all accents are symbols 

2441 | p.symbol # Must be third to catch all named symbols and single chars not in a group 

2442 | p.c_over_c 

2443 | p.function 

2444 | p.group 

2445 | p.frac 

2446 | p.dfrac 

2447 | p.stackrel 

2448 | p.binom 

2449 | p.genfrac 

2450 | p.sqrt 

2451 | p.overline 

2452 | p.operatorname 

2453 ) 

2454 

2455 p.simple <<= ( p.space 

2456 | p.customspace 

2457 | p.font 

2458 | p.subsuper 

2459 ) 

2460 

2461 p.subsuperop <<= oneOf(["_", "^"]) 

2462 

2463 p.subsuper <<= Group( 

2464 (Optional(p.placeable) + OneOrMore(p.subsuperop - p.placeable) + Optional(p.apostrophe)) 

2465 | (p.placeable + Optional(p.apostrophe)) 

2466 | p.apostrophe 

2467 ) 

2468 

2469 p.token <<= ( p.simple 

2470 | p.auto_delim 

2471 | p.unknown_symbol # Must be last 

2472 ) 

2473 

2474 p.auto_delim <<= (Suppress(Literal(r"\left")) 

2475 - ((p.left_delim | p.ambi_delim) | Error("Expected a delimiter")) 

2476 + Group(ZeroOrMore(p.simple | p.auto_delim)) 

2477 + Suppress(Literal(r"\right")) 

2478 - ((p.right_delim | p.ambi_delim) | Error("Expected a delimiter")) 

2479 ) 

2480 

2481 p.math <<= OneOrMore(p.token) 

2482 

2483 p.math_string <<= QuotedString('$', '\\', unquoteResults=False) 

2484 

2485 p.non_math <<= Regex(r"(?:(?:\\[$])|[^$])*").leaveWhitespace() 

2486 

2487 p.main <<= (p.non_math + ZeroOrMore(p.math_string + p.non_math)) + StringEnd() 

2488 

2489 # Set actions 

2490 for key, val in vars(p).items(): 

2491 if not key.startswith('_'): 

2492 if hasattr(self, key): 

2493 val.setParseAction(getattr(self, key)) 

2494 

2495 self._expression = p.main 

2496 self._math_expression = p.math 

2497 

2498 def parse(self, s, fonts_object, fontsize, dpi): 

2499 """ 

2500 Parse expression *s* using the given *fonts_object* for 

2501 output, at the given *fontsize* and *dpi*. 

2502 

2503 Returns the parse tree of :class:`Node` instances. 

2504 """ 

2505 self._state_stack = [self.State(fonts_object, 'default', 'rm', fontsize, dpi)] 

2506 self._em_width_cache = {} 

2507 try: 

2508 result = self._expression.parseString(s) 

2509 except ParseBaseException as err: 

2510 raise ValueError("\n".join(["", 

2511 err.line, 

2512 " " * (err.column - 1) + "^", 

2513 str(err)])) 

2514 self._state_stack = None 

2515 self._em_width_cache = {} 

2516 self._expression.resetCache() 

2517 return result[0] 

2518 

2519 # The state of the parser is maintained in a stack. Upon 

2520 # entering and leaving a group { } or math/non-math, the stack 

2521 # is pushed and popped accordingly. The current state always 

2522 # exists in the top element of the stack. 

2523 class State(object): 

2524 """ 

2525 Stores the state of the parser. 

2526 

2527 States are pushed and popped from a stack as necessary, and 

2528 the "current" state is always at the top of the stack. 

2529 """ 

2530 def __init__(self, font_output, font, font_class, fontsize, dpi): 

2531 self.font_output = font_output 

2532 self._font = font 

2533 self.font_class = font_class 

2534 self.fontsize = fontsize 

2535 self.dpi = dpi 

2536 

2537 def copy(self): 

2538 return Parser.State( 

2539 self.font_output, 

2540 self.font, 

2541 self.font_class, 

2542 self.fontsize, 

2543 self.dpi) 

2544 

2545 def _get_font(self): 

2546 return self._font 

2547 def _set_font(self, name): 

2548 if name in ('rm', 'it', 'bf'): 

2549 self.font_class = name 

2550 self._font = name 

2551 font = property(_get_font, _set_font) 

2552 

2553 def get_state(self): 

2554 """ 

2555 Get the current :class:`State` of the parser. 

2556 """ 

2557 return self._state_stack[-1] 

2558 

2559 def pop_state(self): 

2560 """ 

2561 Pop a :class:`State` off of the stack. 

2562 """ 

2563 self._state_stack.pop() 

2564 

2565 def push_state(self): 

2566 """ 

2567 Push a new :class:`State` onto the stack which is just a copy 

2568 of the current state. 

2569 """ 

2570 self._state_stack.append(self.get_state().copy()) 

2571 

2572 def main(self, s, loc, toks): 

2573 return [Hlist(toks)] 

2574 

2575 def math_string(self, s, loc, toks): 

2576 return self._math_expression.parseString(toks[0][1:-1]) 

2577 

2578 def math(self, s, loc, toks): 

2579 hlist = Hlist(toks) 

2580 self.pop_state() 

2581 return [hlist] 

2582 

2583 def non_math(self, s, loc, toks): 

2584 s = toks[0].replace(r'\$', '$') 

2585 symbols = [Char(c, self.get_state(), math=False) for c in s] 

2586 hlist = Hlist(symbols) 

2587 # We're going into math now, so set font to 'it' 

2588 self.push_state() 

2589 self.get_state().font = rcParams['mathtext.default'] 

2590 return [hlist] 

2591 

2592 def _make_space(self, percentage): 

2593 # All spaces are relative to em width 

2594 state = self.get_state() 

2595 key = (state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2596 width = self._em_width_cache.get(key) 

2597 if width is None: 

2598 metrics = state.font_output.get_metrics( 

2599 state.font, rcParams['mathtext.default'], 'm', state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2600 width = metrics.advance 

2601 self._em_width_cache[key] = width 

2602 return Kern(width * percentage) 

2603 

2604 _space_widths = { r'\,' : 0.16667, # 3/18 em = 3 mu 

2605 r'\thinspace' : 0.16667, # 3/18 em = 3 mu 

2606 r'\/' : 0.16667, # 3/18 em = 3 mu 

2607 r'\>' : 0.22222, # 4/18 em = 4 mu 

2608 r'\:' : 0.22222, # 4/18 em = 4 mu 

2609 r'\;' : 0.27778, # 5/18 em = 5 mu 

2610 r'\ ' : 0.33333, # 6/18 em = 6 mu 

2611 r'\enspace' : 0.5, # 9/18 em = 9 mu 

2612 r'\quad' : 1, # 1 em = 18 mu 

2613 r'\qquad' : 2, # 2 em = 36 mu 

2614 r'\!' : -0.16667, # -3/18 em = -3 mu 

2615 } 

2616 def space(self, s, loc, toks): 

2617 assert len(toks)==1 

2618 num = self._space_widths[toks[0]] 

2619 box = self._make_space(num) 

2620 return [box] 

2621 

2622 def customspace(self, s, loc, toks): 

2623 return [self._make_space(float(toks[0]))] 

2624 

2625 def symbol(self, s, loc, toks): 

2626 c = toks[0] 

2627 try: 

2628 char = Char(c, self.get_state()) 

2629 except ValueError: 

2630 raise ParseFatalException(s, loc, "Unknown symbol: %s" % c) 

2631 

2632 if c in self._spaced_symbols: 

2633 # iterate until we find previous character, needed for cases 

2634 # such as ${ -2}$, $ -2$, or $ -2$. 

2635 prev_char = next((c for c in s[:loc][::-1] if c != ' '), '') 

2636 # Binary operators at start of string should not be spaced 

2637 if (c in self._binary_operators and 

2638 (len(s[:loc].split()) == 0 or prev_char == '{' or 

2639 prev_char in self._left_delim)): 

2640 return [char] 

2641 else: 

2642 return [Hlist([self._make_space(0.2), 

2643 char, 

2644 self._make_space(0.2)] , 

2645 do_kern = True)] 

2646 elif c in self._punctuation_symbols: 

2647 

2648 # Do not space commas between brackets 

2649 if c == ',': 

2650 prev_char = next((c for c in s[:loc][::-1] if c != ' '), '') 

2651 next_char = next((c for c in s[loc + 1:] if c != ' '), '') 

2652 if prev_char == '{' and next_char == '}': 

2653 return [char] 

2654 

2655 # Do not space dots as decimal separators 

2656 if c == '.' and s[loc - 1].isdigit() and s[loc + 1].isdigit(): 

2657 return [char] 

2658 else: 

2659 return [Hlist([char, 

2660 self._make_space(0.2)], 

2661 do_kern = True)] 

2662 return [char] 

2663 

2664 snowflake = symbol 

2665 

2666 def unknown_symbol(self, s, loc, toks): 

2667 c = toks[0] 

2668 raise ParseFatalException(s, loc, "Unknown symbol: %s" % c) 

2669 

2670 _char_over_chars = { 

2671 # The first 2 entries in the tuple are (font, char, sizescale) for 

2672 # the two symbols under and over. The third element is the space 

2673 # (in multiples of underline height) 

2674 r'AA': (('it', 'A', 1.0), (None, '\\circ', 0.5), 0.0), 

2675 } 

2676 

2677 def c_over_c(self, s, loc, toks): 

2678 sym = toks[0] 

2679 state = self.get_state() 

2680 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

2681 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2682 

2683 under_desc, over_desc, space = \ 

2684 self._char_over_chars.get(sym, (None, None, 0.0)) 

2685 if under_desc is None: 

2686 raise ParseFatalException("Error parsing symbol") 

2687 

2688 over_state = state.copy() 

2689 if over_desc[0] is not None: 

2690 over_state.font = over_desc[0] 

2691 over_state.fontsize *= over_desc[2] 

2692 over = Accent(over_desc[1], over_state) 

2693 

2694 under_state = state.copy() 

2695 if under_desc[0] is not None: 

2696 under_state.font = under_desc[0] 

2697 under_state.fontsize *= under_desc[2] 

2698 under = Char(under_desc[1], under_state) 

2699 

2700 width = max(over.width, under.width) 

2701 

2702 over_centered = HCentered([over]) 

2703 over_centered.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

2704 

2705 under_centered = HCentered([under]) 

2706 under_centered.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

2707 

2708 return Vlist([ 

2709 over_centered, 

2710 Vbox(0., thickness * space), 

2711 under_centered 

2712 ]) 

2713 

2714 _accent_map = { 

2715 r'hat' : r'\circumflexaccent', 

2716 r'breve' : r'\combiningbreve', 

2717 r'bar' : r'\combiningoverline', 

2718 r'grave' : r'\combininggraveaccent', 

2719 r'acute' : r'\combiningacuteaccent', 

2720 r'tilde' : r'\combiningtilde', 

2721 r'dot' : r'\combiningdotabove', 

2722 r'ddot' : r'\combiningdiaeresis', 

2723 r'vec' : r'\combiningrightarrowabove', 

2724 r'"' : r'\combiningdiaeresis', 

2725 r"`" : r'\combininggraveaccent', 

2726 r"'" : r'\combiningacuteaccent', 

2727 r'~' : r'\combiningtilde', 

2728 r'.' : r'\combiningdotabove', 

2729 r'^' : r'\circumflexaccent', 

2730 r'overrightarrow' : r'\rightarrow', 

2731 r'overleftarrow' : r'\leftarrow', 

2732 r'mathring' : r'\circ' 

2733 } 

2734 

2735 _wide_accents = set(r"widehat widetilde widebar".split()) 

2736 

2737 # make a lambda and call it to get the namespace right 

2738 _snowflake = (lambda am: [p for p in tex2uni if 

2739 any(p.startswith(a) and a != p for a in am)] 

2740 ) (set(_accent_map)) 

2741 

2742 def accent(self, s, loc, toks): 

2743 assert len(toks)==1 

2744 state = self.get_state() 

2745 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

2746 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2747 if len(toks[0]) != 2: 

2748 raise ParseFatalException("Error parsing accent") 

2749 accent, sym = toks[0] 

2750 if accent in self._wide_accents: 

2751 accent_box = AutoWidthChar( 

2752 '\\' + accent, sym.width, state, char_class=Accent) 

2753 else: 

2754 accent_box = Accent(self._accent_map[accent], state) 

2755 if accent == 'mathring': 

2756 accent_box.shrink() 

2757 accent_box.shrink() 

2758 centered = HCentered([Hbox(sym.width / 4.0), accent_box]) 

2759 centered.hpack(sym.width, 'exactly') 

2760 return Vlist([ 

2761 centered, 

2762 Vbox(0., thickness * 2.0), 

2763 Hlist([sym]) 

2764 ]) 

2765 

2766 def function(self, s, loc, toks): 

2767 self.push_state() 

2768 state = self.get_state() 

2769 state.font = 'rm' 

2770 hlist = Hlist([Char(c, state) for c in toks[0]]) 

2771 self.pop_state() 

2772 hlist.function_name = toks[0] 

2773 return hlist 

2774 

2775 def operatorname(self, s, loc, toks): 

2776 self.push_state() 

2777 state = self.get_state() 

2778 state.font = 'rm' 

2779 # Change the font of Chars, but leave Kerns alone 

2780 for c in toks[0]: 

2781 if isinstance(c, Char): 

2782 c.font = 'rm' 

2783 c._update_metrics() 

2784 self.pop_state() 

2785 return Hlist(toks[0]) 

2786 

2787 def start_group(self, s, loc, toks): 

2788 self.push_state() 

2789 # Deal with LaTeX-style font tokens 

2790 if len(toks): 

2791 self.get_state().font = toks[0][4:] 

2792 return [] 

2793 

2794 def group(self, s, loc, toks): 

2795 grp = Hlist(toks[0]) 

2796 return [grp] 

2797 required_group = simple_group = group 

2798 

2799 def end_group(self, s, loc, toks): 

2800 self.pop_state() 

2801 return [] 

2802 

2803 def font(self, s, loc, toks): 

2804 assert len(toks)==1 

2805 name = toks[0] 

2806 self.get_state().font = name 

2807 return [] 

2808 

2809 def is_overunder(self, nucleus): 

2810 if isinstance(nucleus, Char): 

2811 return nucleus.c in self._overunder_symbols 

2812 elif isinstance(nucleus, Hlist) and hasattr(nucleus, 'function_name'): 

2813 return nucleus.function_name in self._overunder_functions 

2814 return False 

2815 

2816 def is_dropsub(self, nucleus): 

2817 if isinstance(nucleus, Char): 

2818 return nucleus.c in self._dropsub_symbols 

2819 return False 

2820 

2821 def is_slanted(self, nucleus): 

2822 if isinstance(nucleus, Char): 

2823 return nucleus.is_slanted() 

2824 return False 

2825 

2826 def is_between_brackets(self, s, loc): 

2827 return False 

2828 

2829 def subsuper(self, s, loc, toks): 

2830 assert len(toks)==1 

2831 

2832 nucleus = None 

2833 sub = None 

2834 super = None 

2835 

2836 # Pick all of the apostrophes out, including first apostrophes that have 

2837 # been parsed as characters 

2838 napostrophes = 0 

2839 new_toks = [] 

2840 for tok in toks[0]: 

2841 if isinstance(tok, str) and tok not in ('^', '_'): 

2842 napostrophes += len(tok) 

2843 elif isinstance(tok, Char) and tok.c == "'": 

2844 napostrophes += 1 

2845 else: 

2846 new_toks.append(tok) 

2847 toks = new_toks 

2848 

2849 if len(toks) == 0: 

2850 assert napostrophes 

2851 nucleus = Hbox(0.0) 

2852 elif len(toks) == 1: 

2853 if not napostrophes: 

2854 return toks[0] # .asList() 

2855 else: 

2856 nucleus = toks[0] 

2857 elif len(toks) in (2, 3): 

2858 # single subscript or superscript 

2859 nucleus = toks[0] if len(toks) == 3 else Hbox(0.0) 

2860 op, next = toks[-2:] 

2861 if op == '_': 

2862 sub = next 

2863 else: 

2864 super = next 

2865 elif len(toks) in (4, 5): 

2866 # subscript and superscript 

2867 nucleus = toks[0] if len(toks) == 5 else Hbox(0.0) 

2868 op1, next1, op2, next2 = toks[-4:] 

2869 if op1 == op2: 

2870 if op1 == '_': 

2871 raise ParseFatalException("Double subscript") 

2872 else: 

2873 raise ParseFatalException("Double superscript") 

2874 if op1 == '_': 

2875 sub = next1 

2876 super = next2 

2877 else: 

2878 super = next1 

2879 sub = next2 

2880 else: 

2881 raise ParseFatalException( 

2882 "Subscript/superscript sequence is too long. " 

2883 "Use braces { } to remove ambiguity.") 

2884 

2885 state = self.get_state() 

2886 rule_thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

2887 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2888 xHeight = state.font_output.get_xheight( 

2889 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

2890 

2891 if napostrophes: 

2892 if super is None: 

2893 super = Hlist([]) 

2894 for i in range(napostrophes): 

2895 super.children.extend(self.symbol(s, loc, ['\\prime'])) 

2896 # kern() and hpack() needed to get the metrics right after extending 

2897 super.kern() 

2898 super.hpack() 

2899 

2900 # Handle over/under symbols, such as sum or integral 

2901 if self.is_overunder(nucleus): 

2902 vlist = [] 

2903 shift = 0. 

2904 width = nucleus.width 

2905 if super is not None: 

2906 super.shrink() 

2907 width = max(width, super.width) 

2908 if sub is not None: 

2909 sub.shrink() 

2910 width = max(width, sub.width) 

2911 

2912 if super is not None: 

2913 hlist = HCentered([super]) 

2914 hlist.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

2915 vlist.extend([hlist, Kern(rule_thickness * 3.0)]) 

2916 hlist = HCentered([nucleus]) 

2917 hlist.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

2918 vlist.append(hlist) 

2919 if sub is not None: 

2920 hlist = HCentered([sub]) 

2921 hlist.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

2922 vlist.extend([Kern(rule_thickness * 3.0), hlist]) 

2923 shift = hlist.height 

2924 vlist = Vlist(vlist) 

2925 vlist.shift_amount = shift + nucleus.depth 

2926 result = Hlist([vlist]) 

2927 return [result] 

2928 

2929 # We remove kerning on the last character for consistency (otherwise it 

2930 # will compute kerning based on non-shrinked characters and may put them 

2931 # too close together when superscripted) 

2932 # We change the width of the last character to match the advance to 

2933 # consider some fonts with weird metrics: e.g. stix's f has a width of 

2934 # 7.75 and a kerning of -4.0 for an advance of 3.72, and we want to put 

2935 # the superscript at the advance 

2936 last_char = nucleus 

2937 if isinstance(nucleus, Hlist): 

2938 new_children = nucleus.children 

2939 if len(new_children): 

2940 # remove last kern 

2941 if (isinstance(new_children[-1],Kern) and 

2942 hasattr(new_children[-2], '_metrics')): 

2943 new_children = new_children[:-1] 

2944 last_char = new_children[-1] 

2945 if hasattr(last_char, '_metrics'): 

2946 last_char.width = last_char._metrics.advance 

2947 # create new Hlist without kerning 

2948 nucleus = Hlist(new_children, do_kern=False) 

2949 else: 

2950 if isinstance(nucleus, Char): 

2951 last_char.width = last_char._metrics.advance 

2952 nucleus = Hlist([nucleus]) 

2953 

2954 # Handle regular sub/superscripts 

2955 constants = _get_font_constant_set(state) 

2956 lc_height = last_char.height 

2957 lc_baseline = 0 

2958 if self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

2959 lc_baseline = last_char.depth 

2960 

2961 # Compute kerning for sub and super 

2962 superkern = constants.delta * xHeight 

2963 subkern = constants.delta * xHeight 

2964 if self.is_slanted(last_char): 

2965 superkern += constants.delta * xHeight 

2966 superkern += (constants.delta_slanted * 

2967 (lc_height - xHeight * 2. / 3.)) 

2968 if self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

2969 subkern = (3 * constants.delta - 

2970 constants.delta_integral) * lc_height 

2971 superkern = (3 * constants.delta + 

2972 constants.delta_integral) * lc_height 

2973 else: 

2974 subkern = 0 

2975 

2976 if super is None: 

2977 # node757 

2978 x = Hlist([Kern(subkern), sub]) 

2979 x.shrink() 

2980 if self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

2981 shift_down = lc_baseline + constants.subdrop * xHeight 

2982 else: 

2983 shift_down = constants.sub1 * xHeight 

2984 x.shift_amount = shift_down 

2985 else: 

2986 x = Hlist([Kern(superkern), super]) 

2987 x.shrink() 

2988 if self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

2989 shift_up = lc_height - constants.subdrop * xHeight 

2990 else: 

2991 shift_up = constants.sup1 * xHeight 

2992 if sub is None: 

2993 x.shift_amount = -shift_up 

2994 else: # Both sub and superscript 

2995 y = Hlist([Kern(subkern),sub]) 

2996 y.shrink() 

2997 if self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

2998 shift_down = lc_baseline + constants.subdrop * xHeight 

2999 else: 

3000 shift_down = constants.sub2 * xHeight 

3001 # If sub and superscript collide, move super up 

3002 clr = (2.0 * rule_thickness - 

3003 ((shift_up - x.depth) - (y.height - shift_down))) 

3004 if clr > 0.: 

3005 shift_up += clr 

3006 x = Vlist([x, 

3007 Kern((shift_up - x.depth) - (y.height - shift_down)), 

3008 y]) 

3009 x.shift_amount = shift_down 

3010 

3011 if not self.is_dropsub(last_char): 

3012 x.width += constants.script_space * xHeight 

3013 result = Hlist([nucleus, x]) 

3014 

3015 return [result] 

3016 

3017 def _genfrac(self, ldelim, rdelim, rule, style, num, den): 

3018 state = self.get_state() 

3019 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

3020 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3021 

3022 rule = float(rule) 

3023 

3024 # If style != displaystyle == 0, shrink the num and den 

3025 if style != self._math_style_dict['displaystyle']: 

3026 num.shrink() 

3027 den.shrink() 

3028 cnum = HCentered([num]) 

3029 cden = HCentered([den]) 

3030 width = max(num.width, den.width) 

3031 cnum.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

3032 cden.hpack(width, 'exactly') 

3033 vlist = Vlist([cnum, # numerator 

3034 Vbox(0, thickness * 2.0), # space 

3035 Hrule(state, rule), # rule 

3036 Vbox(0, thickness * 2.0), # space 

3037 cden # denominator 

3038 ]) 

3039 

3040 # Shift so the fraction line sits in the middle of the 

3041 # equals sign 

3042 metrics = state.font_output.get_metrics( 

3043 state.font, rcParams['mathtext.default'], 

3044 '=', state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3045 shift = (cden.height - 

3046 ((metrics.ymax + metrics.ymin) / 2 - 

3047 thickness * 3.0)) 

3048 vlist.shift_amount = shift 

3049 

3050 result = [Hlist([vlist, Hbox(thickness * 2.)])] 

3051 if ldelim or rdelim: 

3052 if ldelim == '': 

3053 ldelim = '.' 

3054 if rdelim == '': 

3055 rdelim = '.' 

3056 return self._auto_sized_delimiter(ldelim, result, rdelim) 

3057 return result 

3058 

3059 def genfrac(self, s, loc, toks): 

3060 assert len(toks) == 1 

3061 assert len(toks[0]) == 6 

3062 

3063 return self._genfrac(*tuple(toks[0])) 

3064 

3065 def frac(self, s, loc, toks): 

3066 assert len(toks) == 1 

3067 assert len(toks[0]) == 2 

3068 state = self.get_state() 

3069 

3070 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

3071 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3072 num, den = toks[0] 

3073 

3074 return self._genfrac('', '', thickness, 

3075 self._math_style_dict['textstyle'], num, den) 

3076 

3077 def dfrac(self, s, loc, toks): 

3078 assert len(toks) == 1 

3079 assert len(toks[0]) == 2 

3080 state = self.get_state() 

3081 

3082 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

3083 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3084 num, den = toks[0] 

3085 

3086 return self._genfrac('', '', thickness, 

3087 self._math_style_dict['displaystyle'], num, den) 

3088 

3089 def stackrel(self, s, loc, toks): 

3090 assert len(toks) == 1 

3091 assert len(toks[0]) == 2 

3092 num, den = toks[0] 

3093 

3094 return self._genfrac('', '', 0.0, 

3095 self._math_style_dict['textstyle'], num, den)

3097 def binom(self, s, loc, toks): 

3098 assert len(toks) == 1 

3099 assert len(toks[0]) == 2 

3100 num, den = toks[0] 

3101 

3102 return self._genfrac('(', ')', 0.0, 

3103 self._math_style_dict['textstyle'], num, den) 

3104 

3105 def sqrt(self, s, loc, toks): 

3106 root, body = toks[0] 

3107 state = self.get_state() 

3108 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

3109 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3110 

3111 # Determine the height of the body, and add a little extra to 

3112 # the height so it doesn't seem cramped 

3113 height = body.height - body.shift_amount + thickness * 5.0 

3114 depth = body.depth + body.shift_amount 

3115 check = AutoHeightChar(r'\__sqrt__', height, depth, state, always=True) 

3116 height = check.height - check.shift_amount 

3117 depth = check.depth + check.shift_amount 

3118 

3119 # Put a little extra space to the left and right of the body 

3120 padded_body = Hlist([Hbox(thickness * 2.0), 

3121 body, 

3122 Hbox(thickness * 2.0)]) 

3123 rightside = Vlist([Hrule(state), 

3124 Fill(), 

3125 padded_body]) 

3126 # Stretch the glue between the hrule and the body 

3127 rightside.vpack(height + (state.fontsize * state.dpi) / (100.0 * 12.0), 

3128 'exactly', depth) 

3129 

3130 # Add the root and shift it upward so it is above the tick. 

3131 # The value of 0.6 is a hard-coded hack ;) 

3132 if root is None: 

3133 root = Box(check.width * 0.5, 0., 0.) 

3134 else: 

3135 root = Hlist([Char(x, state) for x in root]) 

3136 root.shrink() 

3137 root.shrink() 

3138 

3139 root_vlist = Vlist([Hlist([root])]) 

3140 root_vlist.shift_amount = -height * 0.6 

3141 

3142 hlist = Hlist([root_vlist, # Root 

3143 # Negative kerning to put root over tick 

3144 Kern(-check.width * 0.5), 

3145 check, # Check 

3146 rightside]) # Body 

3147 return [hlist] 

3148 

3149 def overline(self, s, loc, toks): 

3150 assert len(toks)==1 

3151 assert len(toks[0])==1 

3152 

3153 body = toks[0][0] 

3154 

3155 state = self.get_state() 

3156 thickness = state.font_output.get_underline_thickness( 

3157 state.font, state.fontsize, state.dpi) 

3158 

3159 height = body.height - body.shift_amount + thickness * 3.0 

3160 depth = body.depth + body.shift_amount 

3161 

3162 # Place overline above body 

3163 rightside = Vlist([Hrule(state), 

3164 Fill(), 

3165 Hlist([body])]) 

3166 

3167 # Stretch the glue between the hrule and the body 

3168 rightside.vpack(height + (state.fontsize * state.dpi) / (100.0 * 12.0), 

3169 'exactly', depth) 

3170 

3171 hlist = Hlist([rightside]) 

3172 return [hlist] 

3173 

3174 def _auto_sized_delimiter(self, front, middle, back): 

3175 state = self.get_state() 

3176 if len(middle): 

3177 height = max(x.height for x in middle) 

3178 depth = max(x.depth for x in middle) 

3179 factor = None 

3180 else: 

3181 height = 0 

3182 depth = 0 

3183 factor = 1.0 

3184 parts = [] 

3185 # \left. and \right. aren't supposed to produce any symbols 

3186 if front != '.': 

3187 parts.append(AutoHeightChar(front, height, depth, state, factor=factor)) 

3188 parts.extend(middle) 

3189 if back != '.': 

3190 parts.append(AutoHeightChar(back, height, depth, state, factor=factor)) 

3191 hlist = Hlist(parts) 

3192 return hlist 

3193 

3194 def auto_delim(self, s, loc, toks): 

3195 front, middle, back = toks 

3196 

3197 return self._auto_sized_delimiter(front, middle.asList(), back)

3204class MathTextParser(object): 

3205 _parser = None 

3206 

3207 _backend_mapping = { 

3208 'bitmap': MathtextBackendBitmap, 

3209 'agg' : MathtextBackendAgg, 

3210 'ps' : MathtextBackendPs, 

3211 'pdf' : MathtextBackendPdf, 

3212 'svg' : MathtextBackendSvg, 

3213 'path' : MathtextBackendPath, 

3214 'cairo' : MathtextBackendCairo, 

3215 'macosx': MathtextBackendAgg, 

3216 } 

3217 

3218 _font_type_mapping = { 

3219 'cm' : BakomaFonts, 

3220 'dejavuserif' : DejaVuSerifFonts, 

3221 'dejavusans' : DejaVuSansFonts, 

3222 'stix' : StixFonts, 

3223 'stixsans' : StixSansFonts, 

3224 'custom' : UnicodeFonts 

3225 } 

3226 

3227 def __init__(self, output): 

3228 """ 

3229 Create a MathTextParser for the given backend *output*. 

3230 """ 

3231 self._output = output.lower() 

3232 

3233 @functools.lru_cache(50) 

3234 def parse(self, s, dpi = 72, prop = None): 

3235 """ 

3236 Parse the given math expression *s* at the given *dpi*. If 

3237 *prop* is provided, it is a 

3238 :class:`~matplotlib.font_manager.FontProperties` object 

3239 specifying the "default" font to use in the math expression, 

3240 used for all non-math text. 

3241 

3242 The results are cached, so multiple calls to :meth:`parse` 

3243 with the same expression should be fast. 

3244 """ 

3245 

3246 if prop is None: 

3247 prop = FontProperties() 

3248 

3249 if self._output == 'ps' and rcParams['ps.useafm']: 

3250 font_output = StandardPsFonts(prop) 

3251 else: 

3252 backend = self._backend_mapping[self._output]() 

3253 fontset = rcParams['mathtext.fontset'] 

3254 fontset_class = self._font_type_mapping.get(fontset.lower()) 

3255 if fontset_class is not None: 

3256 font_output = fontset_class(prop, backend) 

3257 else: 

3258 raise ValueError( 

3259 "mathtext.fontset must be either 'cm', 'dejavuserif', " 

3260 "'dejavusans', 'stix', 'stixsans', or 'custom'") 

3261 

3262 fontsize = prop.get_size_in_points() 

3263 

3264 # This is a class variable so we don't rebuild the parser 

3265 # with each request. 

3266 if self._parser is None: 

3267 self.__class__._parser = Parser() 

3268 

3269 box = self._parser.parse(s, font_output, fontsize, dpi) 

3270 font_output.set_canvas_size(box.width, box.height, box.depth) 

3271 return font_output.get_results(box) 

3272 

3273 def to_mask(self, texstr, dpi=120, fontsize=14): 

3274 """ 

3275 *texstr* 

3276 A valid mathtext string, e.g., r'IQ: $\\sigma_i=15$' 

3277 

3278 *dpi* 

3279 The dots-per-inch to render the text 

3280 

3281 *fontsize* 

3282 The font size in points 

3283 

3284 Returns a tuple (*array*, *depth*) 

3285 

3286 - *array* is an NxM uint8 alpha ubyte mask array of 

3287 rasterized tex. 

3288 

3289 - depth is the offset of the baseline from the bottom of the 

3290 image in pixels. 

3291 """ 

3292 assert self._output == "bitmap" 

3293 prop = FontProperties(size=fontsize) 

3294 ftimage, depth = self.parse(texstr, dpi=dpi, prop=prop) 

3295 

3296 x = ftimage.as_array() 

3297 return x, depth 

3298 

3299 def to_rgba(self, texstr, color='black', dpi=120, fontsize=14): 

3300 """ 

3301 *texstr* 

3302 A valid mathtext string, e.g., r'IQ: $\\sigma_i=15$' 

3303 

3304 *color* 

3305 Any matplotlib color argument 

3306 

3307 *dpi* 

3308 The dots-per-inch to render the text 

3309 

3310 *fontsize* 

3311 The font size in points 

3312 

3313 Returns a tuple (*array*, *depth*) 

3314 

3315 - *array* is an NxM uint8 alpha ubyte mask array of 

3316 rasterized tex. 

3317 

3318 - depth is the offset of the baseline from the bottom of the 

3319 image in pixels. 

3320 """ 

3321 x, depth = self.to_mask(texstr, dpi=dpi, fontsize=fontsize) 

3322 

3323 r, g, b, a = mcolors.to_rgba(color) 

3324 RGBA = np.zeros((x.shape[0], x.shape[1], 4), dtype=np.uint8) 

3325 RGBA[:, :, 0] = 255 * r 

3326 RGBA[:, :, 1] = 255 * g 

3327 RGBA[:, :, 2] = 255 * b 

3328 RGBA[:, :, 3] = x 

3329 return RGBA, depth

3333 Writes a tex expression to a PNG file.

3379def math_to_image(s, filename_or_obj, prop=None, dpi=None, format=None): 

3380 """ 

3381 Given a math expression, renders it in a closely-clipped bounding 

3382 box to an image file. 

3383 

3384 *s* 

3385 A math expression. The math portion should be enclosed in 

3386 dollar signs. 

3387 

3388 *filename_or_obj* 

3389 A filepath or writable file-like object to write the image data 

3390 to. 

3391 

3392 *prop* 

3393 If provided, a FontProperties() object describing the size and 

3394 style of the text. 

3395 

3396 *dpi* 

3397 Override the output dpi, otherwise use the default associated 

3398 with the output format. 

3399 

3400 *format* 

3401 The output format, e.g., 'svg', 'pdf', 'ps' or 'png'. If not 

3402 provided, will be deduced from the filename. 

3403 """ 

3404 from matplotlib import figure 

3405 # backend_agg supports all of the core output formats 

3406 from matplotlib.backends import backend_agg 

3407 

3408 if prop is None: 

3409 prop = FontProperties() 

3410 

3411 parser = MathTextParser('path') 

3412 width, height, depth, _, _ = parser.parse(s, dpi=72, prop=prop) 

3413 

3414 fig = figure.Figure(figsize=(width / 72.0, height / 72.0)) 

3415 fig.text(0, depth/height, s, fontproperties=prop) 

3416 backend_agg.FigureCanvasAgg(fig) 

3417 fig.savefig(filename_or_obj, dpi=dpi, format=format) 

3418 

3419 return depth
